column1: {"issue":"Multiple security issues with the PHP backend"
column2: body:"Though the documention clearly states the PHP backend is not ready\r\nfor production
column3:
multiple Clipperz instances expose a critical PHP code
injection vulnerability as reported on http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/126713/clipperz-exec.txt

Moreover
column4: the whole setup/ folder and test.php should be removed on\r\nproduction setups
column5: thus reducing the risk of data being stolen or destroyed."

column1: {"issue":"Add flag to the database to mark files as analysed"
column2: body:"If files fail analysis (and always will do) they'll keep getting analysed each time round

body:"It could be useful for a user to be able to put restrictions on the alerts they receive
column3: even if it's just the option of only receiving emails/texts for groups to which they belong. As of now they can only alter the incidents they receive alerts for."

column2: body:"As an emergency coordinator
column3: I want to see all updates related to my expertise regardless of incident because sometimes the world goes crazy
column5:
but I'm still responsible for understanding what's going on and effectively coordinating the response.

There are a couple ways I think we could do this (just sketches of ideas and by no means all options)

1) On the incidents screen
column6: put checkboxes next to incidents and let user create one meta-incident\r\n2) Have a preconfigured meta incident which can be opened with a click of a button and then with additional filters/checkboxes to make custom meta incident\r\n3) Keep a permanent incident open with existing functionality that includes all updates."

column2: body:"When a user resets their passsword
column3: they should be taken to a screen to immediately reset their password to something they created so the person doesn't need to remember a crappy system generated key."

column2: body:"Caching the permission lookups reduces the number of database queries on every page load sometimes by a few orders of magnitude. For example
column4: the number of requests was reduced from 188 to 6. In my local tests
column5: pages with large lists can load upwards of 3 times faster than they did earlier."

column2: body:"(I'm merging other website tickets into this one.)\n\nThis is a page-content outline I've come up with. I have actual mockups of each page done too
column3:
but they're on a whiteboard and I don't have my camera with me right now. Please comment/let me know what you think of the general outline/if you think there are things that need to be added. I'm going to make this next week.

#### Homepage

* Some sort of graphic that's not just a screenshot
* Calls to action: use collabbit
column5:
take a feature tour
* list some organizations that use collabbit
* pull in news from the blog or something (related: we actually need to start doing updates on the blog)
* show the main people that contribute to collabbit

#### About

* mission statement
* full list of contributors
* larger list of people who use collabbit
* history/description of project
* press

#### Contribute

* information for technical and non-technical people
* links to mailing list
column7:
how to get started
* step-by-step description of how to get changes incorporated into collabbit

#### Use

* hosted vs installed version
* hosted version: description and limitations (this part's in beta)
column8: and a form to request an instance\n* installed version: description and limitations (less frequent updates
column11:
link to instructions on getting it running.

#### Features

* tour of Collabbit features. should be in text form
column12: but maybe also a video?\n* our future plans for features (easy data export

column2: body:"I don't think the overview page is especially useful right now. When people start using Collabbit more seriously
column3: I think it's going to be very important for them to see new comments on their updates
column4: new comments on updates they've commented on
column5:
and maybe a few other similar kinds of information. I think that alerts about this kind of stuff are exactly what the overview page should be. I think the point of the overview page should be to get you up to speed very quickly on everything that's happened since you were last logged on (or maybe just everything that's happened recently).

These are the things that I think the overview page should do:

* Show incidents that have changed (closed
column7:
new updates)
* Show comments on updates the user has created
* Show comments on updates the user has commented on

I don't think it should show a list of all of the incidents
column8: which is what it's doing right now
column9: and I think incidents should be ordered by the last time they were changed rather than by when they were created. We've talked about how the incidents/index page is basically just duplicating the functionality of the overview page before
column10: and most of our discussion has focused on either getting rid of the incidents page or making *it* more useful. I think we should focus on the overview page instead: it's what everyone sees when they first log in to Collabbit
column11: and I don't think it's particularly useful right now.\n\nThoughts?"

column1: {"issue":"Integrate tutorials to show when a user first logs on"
column2:
body:"I think these get divided up into a few sections.

#### The Basics
A paragraph or so of text (and maybe a picture) each. Someone who's not afraid of technology should be able to take five minutes
column4:
and jump right in. Should explain the *reason* for the feature rather than just explaining the feature too. (Example: contacts are there to make it easy to find people the right people to talk to.)

* explain what contacts are
* explain what groups are
* explain what incidents and updates are
* explain how notifications (texts/emails) work

#### Tutorials
Either video or text + images (both would probably be good)
column5:
these are for people who want step-by-step instructions on how to use Collabbit.

* how to join groups
* how to add an update
* how to filter updates/contacts (and do interesting things with that
column6:
like send a mass email)


Anything else we're likely to need? I think this covers the basics
column7: but I'm not exactly a model of the target user for this
column8: so I've probably missed some things."

column2: body:"We should have better styling for mobile devices
column5: on the main updates page. Android
column7: and the latest versions of the Blackberry OS support CSS media queries
column8: so I think that's the best way to do it.\r\n\r\nThis will be my project at some point. Probably nearer the end of this summer."

column2: body:"We need to decide exactly how we want exports to work. This will be my project for the second half of the summer."

column1: {"issue":"instance overview and incidents index are too redundant"
column2: body:"They are essentially the same information with slightly different stying. Perhaps the overview page should be more of a welcome page to the specific instance and list only the most recent incidents. Something along the  lines of \"Welcome to the American Red Cross Collabbit page! Here are the latest incidents:\""
body:"Comments on updates for all updates page should be expandable at a reasonable length
column3: like the updates themselves are (with an add \"more\" option). While comments can be really long (filling the height of the browser)
column4: they do seem to be limited in length
column5: but there is no indication of this to the user. If the comment is too long it simply just doesn't post

column2:
body:"SearchLogic is doing something wrong with groups filtering for both users and updates.

Right now the condition we're using is something like this:

    :groups_id_equals_any => [1
column4: ...]\n\nIf a user is a member of multiple groups (say
column5: 1 and 2) then it returns multiple copies of that user. So for the default demo data we get results like this in script/console:\n\n    >> Instance.first.users.groups_id_equals_any([1
column10: and both John Smith/Jane Smith are members of the first three groups.)\n\nThis seems to be a SearchLogic issue. I'd guess that the problem is that we're comparing multiple to multiple and SearchLogic is getting confused. I'm reporting it as a SearchLogic bug (http://github.com/binarylogic/searchlogic/issues/issue/102)."

column2:
body:"New comments on the 'all updates' page should either

* cause the page reload thing to pop up

If we do the former
column3: we should do something fancy to make sure the page doesn't scroll around too much. Possibly pop up a message that doesn't move anything around it for each update that has new comments."

column5: it should include updates targeting all groups.\r\n\r\n"

column2: body:"When adding an update to an incident

column2: body:"Many things should be in background jobs
column3: like emails. Check out beanstalk and other delayed job gems."

column1: {"issue":"Write a script to auto-generate config files"
column2: body:"To make setup/installation easier
column3: we should write a bash script that generates an appropriate database.yml
column4: etc. The script should ask the user for information (like database names

column2: body:"We should have a single page (collabbit.org/login) that will take a user's name/password and log them into the correct instance. Right now
column3: we can't provide an easy 'log in' link on our website
column4: and that's problematic. It's not a huge deal right now since we're operating on a small scale
column5: but it will become one if there end up being a lot more groups using our hosted version of Collabbit."

column2: body:"We need a message queue service for background email and SMS management."
body:"Or this repo is dead ?"
body:"Would be helpful if you clearly stated the bootstrap and stylus versions in your read me."
body:"#### Hey
column3:
maintainer(s) of shomeya/bootstrap-stylus!

We at [VersionEye](https://www.versioneye.com/signup?promo_code=BOWER) are working hard to keep up the quality of the bower's registry.

column2: body:"The build couldn't find NHibernate.dll
column3:
i think because ReferencePath in taiga/addon-modules/ModCableBeach/prebuild.xml points to the main bin directory and NHibernate.dll
wasn't there (found it at ./addon-modules/ModreX/ModularRex/bin/NHibernate.dll).

I worked around using
cp ./addon-modules/ModreX/ModularRex/bin/NHibernate.dll bin/
column4: but being cluefree about prebuild I\r\ndon't know how to properly fix it."

column2:
body:"C++11 features available in different Visual Studios versions:
- 2010: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/vcblog/archive/2010/04/06/c-0x-core-language-features-in-vc10-the-table.aspx
- 2012: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/vcblog/archive/2011/09/12/10209291.aspx
- 2013: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/vcblog/archive/2013/12/02/c-11-14-core-language-features-in-vs-2013-and-the-nov-2013-ctp.aspx
- 2015: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/vcblog/archive/2015/06/19/c-11-14-17-features-in-vs-2015-rtm.aspx

The C++11 additions to VS 2012 are rather underwhelming and with the Community version available beginning from VS 2013
column3: the Express versions are becoming quite obsolete for individual/opensource/home developers Personally I would suggest maybe moving to VS 2013 feature set as the minimum requirement at some point.\r\n"

column2: body:"If enhanced instruction architectures are enabled
column3: some math code (e.g. sending optimized rigid body messages) will not work correctly on VS2013.\r\n\r\nCurrently this is worked around by disabling the instruction set in root-level CMakeLists."

body:"jsdoc recently made a change that runs the application code with js strict mode. I can't imagine what the reasoning for this might be
column3:
forcing non strict code to go this way will create breakages.

I have fixed this in Meshmoon web-rocket already. I would imagine cherry picking it here until we base our impl to this repo will be impossible.

But the fix is to put `"use strict";` as the first line inside the `define()` function in the file its complaining about. Then F5 run client.html and go fix the place
column4: chrome dev tools will give you exact like by clicking the error. Note that not all strict mode errors happen during file parsing. So for some things you actually have to execute the function to get the strict mode error to dev tools.\r\n\r\nAs said I have gone through the codebase to make jsdoc work
column5:
for file parsing and execution. @cvetan5 can go though my commits and port the changes manually.

Finally test with `grunt doc` that it completes without errors.

column2:
body:"I think we should support skinned skeletal animated meshes out of the box.

In Ogre-Tundra EC_Mesh supports them so that there is a separate skeleton ref attribute which makes sense as Ogre's skel anims are in separate files.

With Three.js however the skeleton and animations are in the same JSON with the geom. But different code is needed to handle them: static meshes with plain `Mesh` and animated with `SkinnedMesh`.

In WebTundra 1.0 (master now) the EC_Mesh implementation supports that by detecting  whether the geometry has bones or not
column3:
and chooses Mesh or SkinnedMesh based on that. That code is in: https://github.com/realXtend/WebTundra/blob/master/src/view/ThreeView.js#L286

I propose the same for 2.x (in dev2 now). I think the place to port that bones check code is: https://github.com/realXtend/WebTundra/blob/dev2/src/view/threejs/asset/ThreeJsonAsset.js#L147

Interestingly the clone() method there already has this kind of check: https://github.com/realXtend/WebTundra/blob/dev2/src/view/threejs/asset/ThreeJsonAsset.js#L110

I wonder when that hits if the loading code never creates SkinnedMesh?

Made a test case for this first using the deer from lvm / chesapeake bay:
source: https://github.com/playsign/webtundra-deer
demo: http://playsign.github.io/webtundra-deer/

The code there is simply: 
`var deer = this._createMesh("Deer"
column4:
"webtundra://White_Tailed_Deer_all.json");`

Now it shows both without skinning and for some reason also without the correct materials (with col and spec map textures).

The desired result with using Three.js SkinnedMesh directly is:
demo: https://antont.github.io/three.js/examples/webgl_animation_skinning-deer.html
code: https://github.com/antont/three.js/blob/example_skinning_deer/examples/webgl_animation_skinning-deer.html#L91

So unless there are objections I'll give a shot at modifying `ThreeJsonAsset.js` to do the same automatically (apart from starting the anim)."

column2:
body:"WIP for implementing #78 - see motivation and info about the test for this etc. there.

Not ready to merge but am opening for discussion.

Had to disable material setting in `EC_Mesh_ThreeJs` as it overrode the material from the three.json

I think overall with the current `EC_Mesh_ThreeJs` implementation
column3: the skeleton & material ref handling codes there
column4:
there's a bit of a conflict with the three json (and gltf and others) mesh format where the same file includes skels and animations.

dev2 `EC_Mesh_ThreeJs` is written for Ogre assets where those are separate. Thus much of the EC impl is dealing with loading those other files and applying them etc.

If we recommend use of Three assets
column5: and don't even have the Ogre asset loading available
column6: one way would be indeed to just remove those parts that overwrite the loaded material now. But that may make things difficult for where Ogre assets are used so perhaps what's needed is to make `EC_Mesh_ThreeJs` somehow work for both cases: not overwrite with default white when the mesh already has the correct material.\r\n\r\nI'll check if can do that next but am open for other ideas too. If this one EC impl becomes too complex while handling both cases
column7: perhaps the Ogre things could be moved to some `EC_Mesh_ThreeJsFromOgreAssets` class or so. But perhaps a simple check for existing material does it simply enough.\r\n\r\nAlso
column8: the animation data seemed to be lost somewhere -- am not sure if that's due to the ancient three.js in dev2 still (r62 vs 72dev with which have tested the deer export now otherwise) or if something in the loading & ec mechanism still overrides that."

column2: body:"If I tweak `examples/Avatar/Avatar1.json` to remove all the `parts` except `Sword1` then the demo still works. If I then remove `Sword1` as well
column4: the demo fails. By inserting breakpoints
column5: I see that with `Sword1` the `meshLoaded` signal fires and the animations are loaded *before* the `avatarLoaded` signal
column6: but without `Sword1` the `meshLoaded` signal fires and the animations are loaded *after* the `avatarLoaded` signal.\r\n\r\nIt could be that this is intended
column7: but the docs do say\r\n\r\n> Once the Avatar component has finished loading the description
column8: has instantiated the Mesh component(s) and their mesh assets have loaded
column9: the character is ready to use for animation playback. At this point the Avatar component will emit a signal
column11: to which application code can hook up.\r\n\r\nso it seems to me that it's a bug."

porting to python3 would allow us to load bpy.so (bpy.dll on windows) directly into Tundra.
 Having bpy inside of Tundra would allow us to use all the functions available to blender in background mode.
 For example we could use blender's primitive types and generate ogre meshes on the fly.
 Many cool things could be possible having bpy in Tundra.

http://wiki.blender.org/index.php/User:Ideasman42/BlenderAsPyModule"

body:"Migrate to here from https://github.com/realXtend/naali/issues/87\r\n\r\nPython is not very useful now for EC_Script because it is a gaping security hole. It can be made safe by integrating pypy-sandbox
column3: a standalone python interpreter that is run in a sub-process by pypy_interact.py. pypy_interact.py can be run by the current embedded CPython
column4: so we don't need to remove the current embedded python.\r\n\r\nPypy-sandbox by itself is not very helpful because it won't be able to talk to the Tundra API. So we also need ctypes bindings to Tundra that Pypy-sandbox can load. Ctypes is not the only option
column5: if we want to expose only a small subset of the Tundra API
column6: this could be done with pickle messages over a port talking with pypy_interact.py."

body:"Writing down an idea we discussed with @jonnenauha some weeks ago. Adding a possibility to save the scene in a slimmer format could had its advantages from time to time.

Opportunities for saving space when writing TXML:
1. omit default values of sync property (true) both for entities and components (for entities alternatively the sync value could be deducted from the entity ID)
column8:
and
7. write booleans as "1" and "0" instead of true and false.
EDIT: 8. option to omit line endings also as suggested by @jonnenauha 

A single entity example scene
```xml
<!DOCTYPE Scene>
<scene>
 <entity id="1" sync="true">
  <component typeId="20" type="Placeable" sync="true">
   <attribute value="-66.6853561
column16:
1" type="Transform" id="transform" name="Transform"/>
   <attribute value="false" type="bool" id="drawDebug" name="Show bounding box"/>
   <attribute value="true" type="bool" id="visible" name="Visible"/>
   <attribute value="1" type="int" id="selectionLayer" name="Selection layer"/>
   <attribute value="" type="EntityReference" id="parentRef" name="Parent entity ref"/>
   <attribute value="" type="string" id="parentBone" name="Parent bone name"/>
  </component>
  <component typeId="26" type="Name" sync="true">
   <attribute value="FreeLookCameraSpawnPos" type="string" id="name" name="Name"/>
   <attribute value="" type="string" id="description" name="Description"/>
   <attribute value="" type="string" id="group" name="Group"/>
  </component>
 </entity>
</scene>
```
consisting of 985 characters (CRLF line endings) would become
```xml
<!DOCTYPE Scene>
<scene>
<entity id="1">
<component typeId="20">
<attribute value="-66.6853561

column1: {"issue":"Server not sending all parents before children in initial scene sync"
column2: body:"While I was implementing the drag and drop Entity parenting in scene struct windows
column3:
I noticed this bug. Making a mental note here to fix it later. Also asking for input from @cadaver as you know the sync manager code best and authored Entity parenting.

**How to reproduce**

1. Login to a server with a client.
2. Create two Entities.
3. Parent the smaller id Entity to the bigger entity Id. (eg. Entity #1 to Entity #2).
4. Logout and login back.
5. You should see a warning on the console (client side) `Failed to find parent Entity #2 for Entity`

I looked at the code of the SyncManager server state processing. It looks like the initial scene sync is done in the order of creation (essentially ascending by id). This is not good enough anymore as we have parenting. The result on the client is that scene struct and actually even the code `Entity::Parent()` will lie to the user. The parents creation is not monitored if it fails to be found during creation. I think this is good because we dont want the mess/complexity of `EC_Placeable::parentRef` monitoring.

**Proposed solution**

It's quite simple really if I'm not missing something. Don't send the new Entity messages while processing the state (looping dirty new ents). Instead make a list and insert each item to the correct place as per parenting hierarchy. It might be even faster to create two lists
column4: one for root Entities and after those Entities that have children. Then a secondary list that has any parented Entities.\r\n\r\nAfter all new ents have been processed
column6: it will get fixed. Thanks to the proper hierarchy in the scene descs now
column7: the parent will always get created before the children. Hence getting a smaller id and getting added to the client states prior to the children. I think this is even the case (order of the client sync state) even if new ids are not generated for the scene as the CreateEntity is emitted first for the parent

column1: {"issue":"Windows: --headless crashes when RenderSystem_Headless Ogre renderer not found"
column2: body:"This is windows specific. If `--headless` is passed and `RenderSystem_Headless.dll` is not found Tundra will crash. You can override this by also passing in eg. `--d3d9` to override the .json config renderer selection.\r\n\r\nNeeds to be fixed so that if the wanted render plugin cant be loaded into ogre (dll not found) it will fallback to the system default one."

column2: changeType) - ambiguous call of overloaded function"
column3: body:"Only the component id overload works correctly. Passing in componen typename string with or without the component name is ambiguous. Same thing for the ComponentPtr overload
column4: it seems to be confusing comp ptrs with strings. Possibly beacause `IComponent.toString()` is defined (eg. you can do `print(ent.mesh);`)\r\n\r\nP.S. I am using the Meshmoon Rocket distro. Still needs to be verified if broken in the realXtend repo."

column2: body:"Recently there was some changes that made it possible to create components with a null scene to the constructor. I think before it we didn't have this problem and they were always created to a owning scene. This was a good change
column3: we no longer need a dummy scene to put stuff into for inspection etc. Afaik this feature is mostly used when you drag and drop a .txml into Tundra and want a UI preview without actually adding it to the active scene yet. (This is what I know happens
column4: not sure if it was the reasoning to allow creating components this way).\r\n\r\nAnyhow
column5: now we have a slight problem that has been going on for a while. Components that are not being maintained that well or by programmer error are crashing on this kind of creation. The feature is rarely used so it goes unnoticed untill someone does a .txml import like this.\r\n\r\nIf you use the ctor given `Scene*` or `Framework*` in the ctor youll get a crash like this. We have pretty much fixed all current components (just fixed couple ones in core and meshmoon today)
column6: but this makes writing components hard. Having to know to check for null ptrs.\r\n\r\nAlso sometimes choosing the logic to be done in ctor or handing it during component lifetime and on the `ParentEntitySet` signal is tricky. It is not well known to even me if `ParentEntitySet` signal is emitted **before** `AttributeChanged()` is invoked for the first time with the initial attribute values. So lets say that you want to make a `AssetRefListener` that gets used in `AttributeChanged`
column7: but you only want to do that allocation if you are on a non-headless Tundra instance. As the framework cannot be reliably used in the ctor
column8: you move the headless check and allocation into a slot connected to `ParentEntitySet` signal. Now
column9: is your ref listener still null when you are handling the first value of your asset ref attribute in `AttributeChanged()`? Or maybe I want to do certain allocations only on a server instance?\r\n\r\nThis kind of confusion makes it harder to write components. If I cant figure out the order quickly
column10: I would think more novice Tundra users will have immense problems following the initialization logic/order of a component.\r\n\r\nHence I propose that all component ctors should get a valid `Framework*` into them
column11: that should be passed to the `IComponent` ctor and be set to the `framework` (currently set from the scene ptr
column12:
and left null if that is null) member variable. This way only thing that you need to be aware is if the scene is null. This change should not break anything as nothing but the component factories "new" up components. Framework could be passed to the factories to be used on component creation.

We should also document if the `ParentEntitySet` signal is guaranteed to be emitted before `AttributesChanged()` is invoked.

(Another option suggested by @Stinkfist0 would be to have `Initialize()` function you can override that will get called once when everything is in order.)

**TL;DR** We need to change so that framework ptr is always valid in component constructors."

and the core- and application-level dynamic plugins:

Tests\ (maybe could have such projects at some point?)

```
Math lib omitted intentionally as it would be in the deps folder ideally."

body:"pax-war-tomcat was pulling in pax-jetty.  This was causing all sorts of issues for me

column1: {"issue":"Restore JDK 1.6 compatibility in api and service"
column2: body:"The build target was flipped to JDK7 in 0673135 since log4j2 requires\r\nJDK7. This commits restores JDK1.6 compatibility with the other modules
column3:
leaving 1.7 as the target for pax-logging-log4j2. This does require
sorting out some diamond operator usage in pax-logging-api for the
log4j2 bits
column5:
but I think the this
small effort is worth the compatibility we get in return.

JDK6 is in extended support from Oracle until Dec 2018
column6:
IBM will support
JDK6 even longer.

If we really want pax-logging to require 1.7
column7:
it probably would be
better to at least bump the minor version to 1.9 instead of surprising
users on bumping to the next maintenance version.

Include animal-sniffer plugin to ensure API compatibility for the target
JDK version."

column1: {"issue":"PAXEXAM-674 Configurations and probe builders do not need to be static"
column2: body:"By default
column3: JUnit parameterized tests with PAX Exam need static methods for configuration and probe builders. Notice that this is not mentioned in the documentation. When these methods are not static
column5:
as mentioned in [PAXEXAM-674](https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXEXAM-674).

This patch allows to use non-static methods for configurations and probe builders.
The test class is instantiated with every configuration. And every test class instance comes with its own OSGi configuration.

This was tested with parameterized tests on Apache Karaf 4.0.2.
This patch also comes with support of custom names for parameterized tests (the name attribute of the *Parameters* annotation).

I asked for some feedback on JIRA
column6: but nothing yet.\r\nI hope more will come with this PR."

column1: {"issue":"[PAXEXAM-754] Treat Karaf features as dependencies when useDeployFolder(false)"
column2: body:"When using the KarafFeaturesOption to depend on a feature being available
column4:
the test-dependencies.xml file generated by the Karaf test container will not list the given features as dependencies. This would help ensure that all required bundles were started before running the tests.

This patch scans for existing `KarafFeaturesOption`s too and includes them in the resulting Karaf features repository `test-dependencies.xml`.

Please see [Jira story](https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXEXAM-754)"

column2: body:"Dear Mr. Wellmann\r\n\r\nLately I had to use the Eclipse Sisu JSR-330 container. Because I use Pax-Exam already for OSGi/CDI testing I thought I could write a test-container which integrates with Eclipse Sisu. Sisu is not a CDI container like Weld
column4: it provides similar semantics. Because it does not provide a BeanManager
column5:
I wrote small wrapper proxies which provide the functionality needed by Pax-Exam. You can find a small demo project which uses the new test-container here: https://github.com/SourcePond/paxexam-sisu-demo.git

I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours sincerely
Roland Hauser"

column1: {"issue":"make sure new provisioning idea does not get lost out of existence"
column2:
body:"
make sure new provisioning idea does not get lost out of existence

####################################################



Here is an outline of a possible solution:

1) Use depends-maven-plugin to generate dependencies.properties
column3: listing all transitive dependencies with version and scope in a format easily consumed without a runtime dependency on Maven APIs.\r\n\r\n2) Add a goal to the new exam-maven-plugin to postprocess this properties file
column4:
allowing to include or exclude artifacts by scope or groupId or artifactId patterns. The result of this step should be a file with mvn: URLs.

3) Revive the scanFile() option to provision bundles listed in the file resulting from 2).



1) is already used to support the versionAsInProject() feature.

2) would be a new Mojo for the exam-maven-plugin available on the exam3-milestones branch.

3) is only supported by Pax Runner Container in 2.x
column5: it's deprecated and more or less undocumented
column7:
but it's certainly feasible to reintroduce this option (or a similar one) and make it work for _all_ containers.

See also http://team.ops4j.org/wiki/display/paxscanner/File+Scanner


The details need to be fleshed out
column8: but I think this is doable. Not before Pax Exam 3.1.0

column1: {"issue":"Change KarafTestContainer to rely directly on options and KarafPropertiesFile"
column2: body:"Please do not merge this pull request yet.\r\n\r\nI've created it as entry point for discussion about Pax Exam options used by Karaf test container. In few places we have commas which are simply separators for properties like boot features
column3: repositories and so on. Because of that in many places we need to keep these \"
column4: \" and have values prepended by it. This causes small
column5:
but additional effort in test code.

To avoid string glue for boot features and repositories I prepared additional options:
- **KarafBootFeatureOption**
- **KarafFeatureRepositoryOption**

These options allows to extend bootFeatures and featureRepositories properties in org.apache.karaf.features.cfg file.

Additional option introduced by this commit is **LogCategoryLevelOption** which allows to specify log4j.logger.<category> property inside org.ops4j.pax.logging.cfg.

During my work on these options I've found that lots of options are handled in manual way - ie. each config option has corresponding method in KarafTestContainer. Amount of code duplicated or very similar there is terrifying. If you don't mean
column6: and if you like the approach of unifying option handling
column7: I would like to refactor it a little bit and then merge this pull request."

column1: {"issue":"Allow customization of which env var is used to store the Stripe API Key"
column2: body:"Running multiple apps locally

column1: {"issue":"Ability to store current plans while changing new customers to different plan?"
column2: body:"Great gem! This is not a bug or issue
column3:
just a question...

I have been thinking about how to change the pricing of a new plan while keeping the name and not removing an existing customer from the old plan.

For example
Customer A is signed up with the silver plan at 9.99 a month
We want to change the silver plan to 12.99 a month but keep Customer A on the 9.99 price
We want new customers to still see "Silver Plan" but at the 12.99
column4: and old customers to see \"Silver Plan\" but at 9.99\r\n\r\nAny ideas on how to tweak the system for something like this?"

```

export default Ember.Route.extend({
    fetch: function(pageOffset

body:"- [ ] put sliders on parameters
- [ ] load horizon and unload horizon sliders should be dynamic
- [ ] put transitions on load horizon

- [ ] fix rendering of unload horizon
- [ ] initialReadOffset renders new dataset at that readOffset
- [ ] pageSize renders new dataset at the currentReadOffset
- [ ] creates new instance of initialReadOffset and pageSize after user confirms on click
- [ ] add a 'Go' button for user to click for initialReadOffset and pageSize
- [ ] button can't be clicked unless initialReadOffset and pageSize values have changed
- [ ] sliders should have min/max values

body:"Hi
column3: I've done some little refactoring in your specs

column1: {"issue":"Do not assign properties who's value is nil"
column2: body:""
body:"First off: Big \"thank you\" for working on this nice package. We're using it in Bookyt with great success:-)\r\n\r\nThere's a couple of forks out there
column3: each providing some missing support or fixing some issues. My branch at https://github.com/CyTeam/mt940_parser is among those. I just got a [PR by @alexanderadam](https://github.com/CyTeam/mt940_parser/pull/2) fixing an issue with some banks.\r\n\r\nNow
column4: I'd like to have this fix upstream
column5: in a released version.\r\n\r\nUnfortunately when I needed the library it failed to parse the files I had and I found out that it was a bit too opinionated about some fields. @tom025 had a [nice branch ](https://github.com/LyagushkaLimited/mt940_parser)with some changes that worked for me. But they are a bit intrusive
column6:
so simply merging is not possible.

I went through the changes again to see if we could get the branches merged again. Here's a list of the relevant changes:
* introduce rspec unit tests
* Add OpeningBalance
* Change meaning of
** 25/Account
** 28/Statement
** 68/StatementLineInformation
The other changes are mostly non-functional and could be ignored IMHO.

I think adding the OpeningBalance is a no-brainer
column7: just needs to be ported.\r\n\r\nThe additional specs seem to be nice
column8: but could well be ported to test-unit. They also mostly tackle the changed classes for 25
column10: 68. Which brings us to the most tricky part:\r\n\r\nThe classes for Account
column12: StatementLineInformation are more opiniated regarding content of the fields than the MT940 spec describes. They parse implementation specific fields. @tom025 therefore deprecates and replaces them with implementations that are closer to the standard. He delegates unknown methods back to the old implementations
column13:
but with a deprecation warning.

As mentioned your gem failed on my files because it expected non-standard field formats. Therefore I really would like to see the changes in this area integrated.

Question: would you accept PRs that supersede the mentioned classes with new implementations as visible in our branch at https://github.com/CyTeam/mt940_parser?"

body:"Tons of cleanups on the Qt version of the Transmission client:

removed Qt4 support since lots of goodies are on Qt5 only and we have it for already 4 years
constant strings now use QStringLiteral for creation
column3: and QLatin1String for comparisson\r\nfixes for the mac Qt Client (it's my second machine

so I use it to compile stuff)
don't detach temporary lists / vectors
massive removal of uneeded includes (around 250 removed includes)
and more to come."

column1: {"issue":"Support remote session over ssl on the client"
column2: body:"Even though the server daemon does not support connections over ssl
column3: it is easy to set up apache or nginx to proxy transmission over ssl
column4: in which case it is convenient that the  client support connections over ssl.\r\n\r\nThis PR add two preferences to settings.json
column5: `remote-session-use-ssl` to tell the client to use a ssl connection
column6: and `remote-session-use-any-cert` to tell the cliento to accept any certificate."

column1: {"issue":"Torrent properties window size is saved as a preference."
column2: body:"Oftentimes I find myself enlarging the torrent properties window
column3: so that the filenames can be seen in full. I thought it would nice if Transmission remembered the last size of the properties window.\r\n\r\nTested on Ubuntu 12.04~14.04

column2: body:"Symfony2 requires the use of `acl` for file permissions
column3: and we've been using it extensively with Magento too.  I've generally been installing and configuring it manually ([per this guide](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FilePermissionsACLs#Enabling_ACLs_in_the_Filesystem)) but it would be cool if that could be automated."

column1: {"issue":"DB creation fails if wrong admin password is used"
column2: body:"Issue occurs on [deploy-site.sh:122](https://github.com/lmbbox/Ubuntu-Server-Deploy/blob/master/deploy.d/apache/deploy-site.sh#L122).  Script doesn't check for an invalid MySQL password.  This becomes troublesome when PMP doesn't copy the mysql password to your clipboard (but you've previously copied the sudo password
column3: and so it still says \"password copied\")."

column2: body:"_This is moved from cdent/twikifier#27_\r\n\r\nWhen the nodejs side of the socket exits
column3: the socket connection will close. On the python side it would be ideal handle this tidily. At the moment we don't actually know quite what hapens; instead there is a bunch of hopeful code catching various exceptions. This needs to be audited in the face of real conditions and made to the correct thing.\r\n\r\nWhat the correct thing is depends on the circumstances. If there has been a timeout of some kind we may wish to try again. However if the other side disconnected because it crapped out on bad data
column4: we don't want to send that data again (and again
column6: underlying this issue is the need for a real test environment for _both_ sides of the twikifier processing. One which models real life. The lack thereof is simply the result of the usual \"we spiked this thing\" and now it is a critical piece of infrastructure."

column2: body:"The UI does not respond to failed requests so the user is unaware of why their action did not work.\r\n\r\nSomething like the alerts shown in the spaceui space might be suitable."

body:"Initially created by @FND at tiddlyspace/tiddlyspace#1012

The problem was fixed in the built in registration frontpage but not (at least not fully) this one.

When visiting the frontpage anonymously
column3: it invites* you to log in.\r\n\r\nAfter clicking on that link
column4: the registration form turns into a login form - here it'd be nice if the username field was focused automatically.\r\n\r\n(If one were a douchebag going for conversion
column5:
one might argue that the registration form should also get auto-focus.)


\* although the tiny link isn't particularly inviting

column2: body:"Presumably dates should be shown and _maybe_ tags."

body:"A point was raised on IRC about what sort of tiddlers would be useful to see on a realtime feed an what would not.  There is a desire to filter out tiddler traffic such as application code files (JS
column3: CSS etc...).\r\n\r\nThe server side code of the node application could filter out tiddlers by content type before sending them on to client subscribers."

column1: {"issue":"websocket info occupies too much space on frontpage"
column2: body:"moved from TiddlySpace/tiddlyspace#945\r\n\r\nIf you view the frontpage from a laptop with a small screen
column3: the websocket feed occupies too much vertical space relative to the rest of the page.  This says either that it is too big
column4:
or the content above is insufficiently informative in the space available.

Some options:

* make the feed display less tall
column7: not three\r\n* make it much smaller per tiddler
column9: shifting the main content left or right\r\n* make it smaller
column11: placed directly below the first thick black border (just above \"bring your thoughts to life\")\r\n\r\nAs things stand it looks too much like what it is: a thing we stuck on the page in a hurry
column12:
not an integrated piece of the display.

Still hoping @colmjude is gonna bring the hammer down on this one.
"

column1: {"issue":"Private tiddlers incorrectly showing up as orphans"
column2:
body:"When using the tiddlywiki view of a space private tiddlers are incorrectly shown as orphans in the orphans tab.

Easiest way to test this is:
* create a new space.
* create and tiddler that links 2 tiddlers. Make these 2 tiddlers with one being public and one private.
* Then look at the **Orphans** tab and you'll see the private tiddler in here even though it is linked to from the initial tiddler."

column1: {"issue":"SiteIcon PUT should go through validator to resize and get _cache-max-age"
column2: body:"Lots of people PUT rather large SiteIcon tiddlers
column3: which is expensive on a variety of dimensions. If we wanted
column4: we could use a [validator](http://tiddlyweb.tiddlyspace.com/validator) to resize it and set a `_cache-max-age` header.\r\n\r\nWe could also consider doing these adjustments client side but that would not catch all interfaces."

"

column1: {"issue":"clean1 friendlytiddler.html needs to include decision making metadata somewhere"
column2: body:"When looking at a friendly tiddler javascript needs to know if this tiddler is a) from this space and (maybe) b) writeable by the current user.\r\n\r\nOtherwise it is difficult to make a decision about things like \"adding a widget with a link to whatever the current editor is\"
column3: as done in [editedit.js](http://edit.tiddlyspace.com/editedit.js).\r\n\r\nAt the moment this information is available on the api (`tiddler.html`) but not `friendlytiddler.html`."

column2: body:"It would be very desirable to be able to filter upon inclusion.\r\n\r\nCurrently
column4: you don't get a controlled inclusion and often include redundant tiddlers. Or
column6:
if undesired included information in some way conflicts (programatically) or simply is inappropriate content wise.

I propose a filter option next to the inclusion feature in _space. Here's a mockup:
https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-yVMjLrJpO4g/UREuqTJthDI/AAAAAAAAEL4/JTeKdrqFMnE/s800/InclusionFiltersgif.gif

There are futher comments on the mockup at:
http://tidbits.tiddlyspace.com/#[[Filtering%20on%20inclusion]]

...and there is a discussion on the ts google group:
https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/tiddlyspace/46G0BQOTxyw

In the discussion
column7:
the a suggestion to see the filters for previously included spaces is mentioned which is a very good idea (but not reflected in the mockup).  

Thank you!

<:-)"

column1: {"issue":"twdispatcher does not kill child processes when stopped/restarted"
column2: body:"When stopping/resarting twdispatcher
column3: the script kills the parent but not the child processes.  They are left orphaned and have to be killed off manually."

column1: {"issue":"Members included in spaces should be notified of their inclusion"
column2: body:"Adding a new member to a space should create a tiddler tagged for their attention.  This does assume that they are aware of the social model surrounding tiddlers in TiddlySpace.\r\n\r\nThere is a choice as to which space the tiddler should live in
column3: either the member's home space or the space they were added to.  \r\n\r\nThe first option could be perceived by some as an unwanted intrusion and I imagine is non-trivial to implement as a new bag with the appropriate policies would have to be created for this purpose.  The second option is more light-touch to do and what I would go for."

column1: {"issue":"non-unicode policy data in instance.py causes warnings in sqlalchemy"
column2: body:"The data model expects (correctly) unicode
column3: so when it receives str it gets annoyed and announced a warning. These warnings don't impact service
column4:
but they do make effective testing harder (where one would prefer all warnings to be treated as errors with tracebacks).

I'm not sure where the best place to enforce unicode policy or do str->unicode transformation should be:

* at the source data (that is
column5:
in the instance file)
* in the model classes
* in the Storage implementation

Option 1 is most explicit and thus probably best but means the instance file needs `u''` all over it. Option 2 is hard to do with the simple data only classes that TiddlyWeb desires. Option 3 has a magic at a distance feel.

/cc @FND @pads"

_account

column1: {"issue":"Unincluding a space doesn't highlight spaces cascade"
column2: body:"When a user unincludes a space
column4: the UI used to inform the user about the other spaces that the had been included when X was first included. I.e. all the spaces X includes.\n\nThis allowed the user to be able to make an informed decision about which spaces to keep or which still needed to be removed. This no longer exists and causes confusion for users."

column1: {"issue":"Renaming an included \"New Tiddler\" causes wrong \"error saving xxx\" message"
column2:
body:"#### How to reproduce:

 * Create a space with a public "New Tiddler"
 * Include this space into an existing space.
   * make sure this space doesn't contain a "New Tiddler"
 * Open the tiddler with the "new tiddler" button
 * rename the tiddler eg: myTiddler
 * save

-> "Error saving myTiddler: Not Found"

----

Firebug shows:
```
GET http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/New%20Tiddler/revisions?fat=1
404 Not Found

"NetworkError: 404 Not Found - http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/New%20Tiddler/revisions?fat=1"
```
----

If everything works OK it looks like: 
```
GET http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/New%20Tiddler/revisions?fat=1
200 OK

POST http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/aaaaa/revisions
204 No Content

GET http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/aaaaa
200 OK

DELETE http://aassddff.tiddlyspace.com/bags/aassddff_public/tiddlers/New%20Tiddler
204 No Content	
```	
 * So TS gets all old revisions and saves them to the new name. 
 * afterwards it deletes the old "New Tiddler" 
 * -> OK

#### Conclusion:
IMO the plugin
column3: that handles the renaming has a bug
column4: since it doesn't handle  the \"GET ...revisions?fat=1 - 404 Not Found\" right.  It stops saving
column5: without any real reason.\n\n * If there are no revisions in the actual space
column6: it means the old tiddler may be an included tiddler\n * This issue is true for any included tiddler
column7: but for \"New Tiddler\" the chance it bites you is higher\n"

column1: {"issue":"tiddlywiki backstage includes upload tiddler interface in tiddlers tab"
column2: body:"This means the tiddlers tab is customized.\n\nWithout it
column3: the default tiddlers tab (from plain TiddlyWiki) could be used.\n\nUploading a binary is probably better handled elsewhere
column4: and allow for things like setting title and tags."

column2: body:"As currently constituted it doesn't show anything but a show button
column3: and then when you click \"show\" it shows the info
column4:
but without a boundary or any other styling to set it off effectively. 

Better would be:

* show the first N characters of any existing info
column5: with clickable ellipsis to show more\n* show a \"change\" or \"update\" button (not \"edit\")"

column1: {"issue":"ToggleTiddlerPrivacyPlugin does not work for >1MB binary tiddlers"
column2: body:"See: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/tiddlyspace/8L_cIPZn_Rg/1pfj25cepqgJ\n\nEssentially: a binary tiddler that is included in the wiki can have its privacy toggled. One that is present only as link is not. There's probably a complex of interacting plugins involved so it would be good to get the correct solution
column3: not just cover over the mess with a bandaid."

column1: {"issue":"tiddlywiki backstage plugins tab does not report errors"
column2: body:"The plugins tab implies that you can \"remove systemConfig tag\" or \"delete\" various plugins
column3: but for most of the plugins the current user actually has no permission to do so.\n\nHowever when an effort is made to do so
column4:
no error is reported.

Instead you get the "Unsaved tiddlers listed below" in the top of the backstage dropdown.

Either the error message should be reported
column5: or the click shouldn't even be allowed on those files which can't be changed.\n\nWe can't simply disable the interface as local plugins _can_ can be changed and presumably that functionality ought to be maintained."

body:"#### Hey
column3:
maintainer(s) of bem/bem-gen-doc!

We at [VersionEye](https://www.versioneye.com/signup?promo_code=BOWER) are working hard to keep up the quality of the bower's registry.

We just finished our initial analysis of the quality of the Bower.io registry:

**7530** - registered packages
column5:
your library `bem/bem-gen-doc` is one of them.

Can you spare **15** minutes to help us to make Bower better?


Just add a new file `bower.json` and  change attributes.

```
{
  "name": "bem/bem-gen-doc"

column2: body:"Для случая зависимостей `A → B → C`\r\n\r\nЕсли библиотека `A` опирается на другую (`B`)
column7:
если внутрь `B` явно не выкачать `C`.

### Пример

В библиотеках `bl-controls` и `lego-controls` используются технологии из `bem-bl`: `bemhtml`
column8:
`html`. При этом `lego-controls` — это расширение блоков `bl-controls`.

Пути до технологии `bemhtml` в конфигах уровней каждой библиотеки прописаны свои относительные

```
bl-contols/
  .bem/
    levels/
      blocks.js  // Level#getTechs() → { 'bemhtml' : '../../lib/bem-bl/[..]/techs/bemhtml.js' }
  lib/bem-bl/
    [...]/techs/bemhtml.js
  desktop.blocks/
    button/
      button.bemhtml
```

```
lego-contols/
  .bem/
    levels/
      blocks.js  // Level#getTechs() → { 'bemhtml' : '../../lib/bem-bl/[..]/techs/bemhtml.js' }
  lib/bl-controls/
    .bem/
    desktop.blocks/
  lib/bem-bl/
    .bem/
    [...]/techs/bemhtml.js
  desktop.blocks/
    button/
      button.bemhtml
```

Если попытаться провести полную интроспекцию для `lego-controls`
column9: то блоки внутри `lib/bl-contols` найдены не будут
column10:
т.к. конфиг уровня блоков (`.bem/level.js`) будет описывать технологии по несуществующим (для lego-controls) путям поскольку зависимые библиотеки через `Arch#getLibraries()` мы сейчас выкачивать не можем.

Это аффектит построение полного сайта библиотеки и что делать пока не понятно.

/cc @arikon @scf2k @veged "

body:"Нужно чтобы у каждого примера можно было посмотреть его файловую структуру и исходные коды значимых технологий.\r\n\r\nОтдельно стоит подумать о отображение БЭМ-структуры примера (какие БЭМ-сущности в него входят и с каких уровней переопределения)"
body:"Сейчас локи — это число в `this.lock`
column5: что лок взят.\n\nС локами есть проблема
column6: когда выполняются несколько узлов параллельно и один их них фейлится. При этом между событием фейла первого узла и обработкой фейла плана второй узел успевает вызвать `arch.withLock()`
column7: в связи с чем устанавливается лок на arch (и на все связанные с ним планы).\n\nПолучается так
column8: что во время обработки фейла плана план заблокирован
column9: то есть находится в слегка грязном состоянии.\n\nНадо пересмотреть всё идею локов: для чего мы их делаем
column10: как именно они должны работать внутри."

body:"Сейчас шаблон (внутренней) страницы описан в `.bem/make.js`. `bemjson.js` для каждой страницы (в том числе языковые версии) генерируется в `.bem/make.js`.

Нужно:

- вынести шаблон внутренней страницы в отдельный блок (`bemhtml` или `priv.js`)
- блоку на вход должен подаваться sitemap и контекст
контент которых лежит во внешних файлах"
column5:
в котором:

- копипаст структуры страницы
- захардкожен контент

Нужно:

- вынести общую структуру в отдельный блок / шаблон
- вынести контент блоков в отдельные `.md` / `.wiki` файлы"

column2: body:"Для многих `starter-kit` даёт точное описание того
column3: что несёт в себе данное название. Я когда впервые объяснял на студии про `project-stub` на меня смотрели с недоумением. Что ещё это за штука такая? Зачем ставить какой-то `project-stub`?\r\n\r\nИли сделать отдельный репозиторий с новым project-stub со всеми принятыми изменениями."

body:"Большой проблемой на первых этапах является данная картина.
![2016-07-27 23-37-22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1655916/17191592/40420660-5453-11e6-9473-67584c374f9e.png). 
После сборки куча промежуточных таргетов. Почему бы временные не хранить в `.tmp`? Или есть какие-то жёсткие рамки?

Или пойти методом от обратного и конечные таргеты хранить в
`bundles/*/dist`"

body:"I'm starting this thread for companies that would like to be referred to as „using BEM“.
If you can add link to repository with codestyle / build scripts or write a quote about „Why you recommend BEM“  - we will pick best ones and put them on site too.

To add your company to the list
column3:
please provide:
1. Company's international (English-based) logo in SVG format
2. Link to company's international site
3. Any confirmation that your company uses the BEM

or you can just create PR to https://github.com/bem-site/bem.info/blob/master/content/methodology/methodology.ru.bemjson.js"

column2: body:"Hi
column4: but the areas that need clarity are (I think I know the answers
column5:
but they need to be added to the docs):

1. What happens when a component / block contains another component / block. How does the classing interact. Is there overlap? Can the child of one block be the root of another block? `header-button Button`

2. Can a child also have a modifier? In your examples it is always the root element that has a modifier. Is this OK `block-name__elem-name_mod-name`. If this is not allowed
column6: how should it be handled. For example a button with an icon vs a button with a large icon.\r\n\r\n3. How do you handle breakpoints? For example if you have a class of `sidebar_position_left` how do you position the element to the right at a breakpoint without leaving a class that is now incorrect on the element? Obviously hardcoding 'left' might be a bad idea
column7: but the same could be true for any style added by a class that is overridden at a breakpoint.\r\n\r\n4. If you specialise a block
column8: for example `data_table` vs `data-table_specialised` how do you then style elements. Is `data-table_specialised__element` correct? Or should you nest `data-table__specialized data_table__element`? This is a really important part of naming that I have almost never seen discussed.\r\n\r\nWith clarity on these kind of issues in the docs
column9:
I think peoples use of BEM naming would be much more consistent.





"

column2: body:""
body:"@tadatuta "
body:"Странный пункт. Ощущение
column3: будто вопрос и ответ вообще не связаны друг с другом.\r\nhttps://ru.bem.info/faq/#Почему-нельзя-писать-div-classblock_mod-вместо-div-classblock-block_mod-если-имя-модификатора-уже-содержит-всю-информацию-о-блоке"

body:"https://ru.bem.info/libs/bem-core/v2.7.0/desktop/i-bem/jsdoc/#jsdoc-toggleMod-1

- нет описания на русском.
- ```modVal1```
column3: ```modVal2``` могуть принимать не только строковые значения
column4: но и булевы.\r\n- из описания не ясно
column6: если не передать ```modVal2```\r\n- не хватает примеров\r\n- код ```this.toggleMod(this.findElem('popular-switcher')
column10: false);``` для класса ```block__elem_popular-switcher``` не меняет модификатор на ```block__elem_popular-switcher_false``` и даже не убирает его
column11: что более желательно. Однако это с успехом делается если в  ```modVal2``` передать ```''``` или ```false``` или же вовсе не определять её."

body:"It turned out that `form.reset()` works wrong with [current way](https://github.com/bem/bem-components/blob/v3/common.blocks/checkbox/checkbox.js#L17-L19) of checking/unchecking checkboxes.

Such variant was introduced in https://github.com/bem/bem-components/commit/012de48146234dc5c1ea47297687046311a0ac6b as a fix for previous change made for a11y: https://github.com/bem/bem-components/commit/db4a1385029ee328550aaacb541b41e021381fea

Is there any way to satisfy a11y and get rid of `attr()` setter?"

body:"How to reproduce:

1. open  https://jsfiddle.net/ze4rn61k/1/
2. be sure that button in the html pan is visible and far enough from window border
3. press the button (you should see a popup) and start to minmize window from right to left

Expected result: popup should be the same after resize
Actual result: popup is corrupted

Correct popup view (before resize):
![2016-04-22 12 16 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/632171/14737292/6b737a52-088c-11e6-9cd8-87b7420f57b7.png)

Corrupted popup view (after resize):
![2016-04-22 12 17 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/632171/14737316/87d44578-088c-11e6-8ac6-095231dade9c.png)
"

column1: {"issue":"b-page__css: Inconsistent behavior of ie-key for desktop and touch"
column2:
body:"For the same BEMJSON for `b-page` block we have different results

```js
{ elem : 'css'
column4:
ie : true }
```

For desktop:

```html
<!--[if gt IE 9]><!--><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple.css"/><!--<![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 6]><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple.ie6.css"/><![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 7]><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple.ie7.css"/><![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 8]><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple.ie8.css"/><![endif]-->
<!--[if IE 9]><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple.ie9.css"/><![endif]-->
```

For touch:

```html
<!--[if gte IE 9]><link rel="stylesheet" href="_10-simple"/><![endif]-->
```

Note that we lost `.css` suffix on the touch level"

column1: {"issue":"i-bem__dom: Need a proper way to check if block was destroyed"
column2: body:"`BEM.DOM.destruct()` of `i-bem__dom` destructs found blocks in context from first to last. This could lead to some strange effects
column3: when block that has been removed already still is trying to handle events from nested blocks that are in a destructing phase. \r\n\r\nLive example: http://jsbin.com/nuquv/1/edit?html
column6: regardless the fact that it's instance has been destroyed already (there is no `this._ppp` prop in instance). At the same time
column7:
`zooo` is still linked to it's DOM element with `this.domElem`.

So there is no "official" way to handle this situation in general because we can't say is block is still a "live". 

In bem-core's `i-bem__dom` version we could use `this.hasMod('js'
column8: 'inited')` for this cases. May be we could add something similar to bem-bl's one?\r\n\r\n\\cc @dfilatov "

body:"Hello :wave:

:rocket::rocket::rocket:

[jscs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jscs) just published its new version 3.0.4
column3:
which **is not covered by your current version range**. If this pull request passes your tests you can publish your software with the latest version of jscs – otherwise use this branch to work on adaptions and fixes. Happy fixing and merging :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/jscs-dev/node-jscs/releases/tag/v3.0.4)

Version 3.0.3 (2016-06-04):

Fixed some bugs
column4:
correctly output CST errors plus improve speed and memory consumption

Bug fixes

  • requireObjectKeysOnNewLine: do not break on object methods (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Fix: Last method throw in requireObjectKeysOnNewLine (Alexey Yaroshevich)
  • disallowQuotedKeysInObjects: ignore spread properties (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • maximumLineLength: correctly position error for comment nodes (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • disallowUnusedParams: notice AssignmentPattern nodes (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • disallowPaddingNewlinesBeforeKeywords: should not ignore comments (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • disallowObjectKeysOnNewLine: correct error message (Oleg Gaidarenko)

Misc

  • Misc: make linters happy (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Misc: add node 6 to travis (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Misc: do not modify CST in check mode (#2252) (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Misc: remove rules "grouping" (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Misc: bump cst version (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Tests: remove mocha .only call (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Misc: parallelizing build on travis (Alexey Yaroshevich)
  • Misc: Set higher timeout for config generator tests (Alexey Yaroshevich)
  • Build: update cst to 0.3.0 (Henry Zhu)
  • Errors: add ugly exception for validateQuoteMarks of position calc (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Errors: always add to line and column properties (Oleg Gaidarenko)

Docs

  • Docs: Fix small typo in require-early-return (#2259) (Sander Boom)
  • add jscs+eslint info (#2230) (Henry Zhu)
  • Docs: simplify readme a bit more (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • Docs: deprecation clean-up (Oleg Gaidarenko)
  • requireCurlyBraces: small docs corrections (Oleg Gaidarenko)
--- The new version differs by 252 commits (ahead by 252
column5:

column1: {"issue":"i-bem-dom: Ability to unroll all binds that were made in `onInit()` of class"
column2: body:"In some cases bind made in `onInit()` may be *unnecessary* collected and make penalty to performance. Need to investigate realness of the issue and possibility to fix this with current approach."

column1: {"issue":"i-bem-dom: Expose DOM-modification API to BEM-entity instance"
column2: body:"It might be useful to have `update()`

column1: {"issue":"i-bem-dom: Possibility to specify modifier for liveInit*-methods"
column2: body:"Often we face with situation
column3: when block has few children blocks with same names and a different modifiers. In this case it would be very useful opportunity to pass object with properties `block`
column4: `modName` and `modVal` in the methods [`liveInitOnBlockEvent`](https://github.com/bem/bem-core/blob/v3.0.0/common.blocks/i-bem/__dom/i-bem__dom.js#L1307) and [`liveInitOnBlockInsideEvent`](https://github.com/bem/bem-core/blob/v3.0.0/common.blocks/i-bem/__dom/i-bem__dom.js#L1318) as it is now works in the [`liveBindTo`](https://github.com/bem/bem-core/blob/v3.0.0/common.blocks/i-bem/__dom/i-bem__dom.js#L1218)."

Крупные изменения

  • Для работы требуется ENB версии 1.3.0 или выше.

Исправления

  • Исправлено получение MakePlatform из ENB.

Зависимости

  • Модуль chalk@1.1.1 обновлён до версии 1.1.3.
  • Модуль connect@3.4.0 обновлён до версии 3.4.1.
  • Модуль serve-index@1.7.2 обновлён до версии 1.7.3.
  • Модуль serve-static@1.10.0 обновлён до версии 1.10.2.
  • Модуль vow@0.4.11 обновлён до версии 0.4.12.

body:"Hello :wave:

:rocket::rocket::rocket:

[jscs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jscs) just published its new version 3.0.3
column3:
which **is not covered by your current version range**. If this pull request passes your tests you can publish your software with the latest version of jscs – otherwise use this branch to work on adaptions and fixes. Happy fixing and merging :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/jscs-dev/node-jscs/releases/tag/v3.0.3)

Version 3.0.3 (2016-02-16):

Bug Fix

  • Misc: Make an exception for esnext/verbose since they are removed (#2208)
    • Will give a proper error message for any configuration options that should be removed.
  • Revert "Configuration: exclude nested node_modules by default" (#2222)
    • We wanted to ignored nested node_modules by default

column2: body:"When checking the timesheets with --warn-ts-deltas
column3: there seem to be major inconsistencies with the attributes \"work\" and \"remaining\" when a resource is not working full time. Whereas work seems to be in units of man-days
column5: is interpreted as resource-days\r\n- when given in units of \"h\"
column6: is converted into man-days but interpreted as resource days.\r\nFurthermore
column7: calculating the remaining work seems wrong.\r\n\r\nThat definitely is a bit confusing
column10: jd has worked 5/8 of the planned effort
column11:
and estimates that 3/8 are left. Running tj3 --warn-ts-deltas shows a warning:
```
Warning: John Doe requests less remaining effort for task t1
3.0d instead of 4.0d
```
That itself seems wrong. It gets worse
column14: and then ignores the fact that jd only works 4h/day. If all hours are doubled again
column15: then we get the same than before.\r\n\r\nNow it gets really weird
column17:
the remaining effort is now incorrectly compared:
```
Warning: John Doe requests less remaining effort for task t1
1.5d instead of 4.0d
Warning: John Doe is requesting a new task:
  ID: t2
  Name: Unexpected task
  Work: 2.5d  Remaining: 0.0d
```
It now claims that 4d should be left (32hours? 16 hours?) and that jd only expects 1.5d (man-days).

Of course
column18: when mixing hours and days then all is lost."

column2: body:"Hi there
column3:
Is anyone of the developers of TaskJuggler familiarised with "Critical Chain Project Management" (CCPM)?

If yes
column4: is there a way of using TJ with this paradigm of managing projects? \r\n\r\nIf not: there are some paid software for CCPM
column5:
but no open source and maybe you already have a roadmap to develop in this direction. 

See https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mpc_FdAt75A for a brief introduction to CCPM and it's differences to the standard approach. 
thanks

column2:
body:"
[bad.tjp.txt](https://github.com/taskjuggler/TaskJuggler/files/157325/bad.tjp.txt)

When I apply Ubuntu 14 tj3 (v3.5.0) to the attached project file
column3:
I'm getting a scary stack overflow:
```
$ tj3 bad.tjp
Fatal: stack level too deep
/var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/PropertyTreeNode.rb:692

*******************************************************************************
You have triggered a bug in TaskJuggler version 3.5.0!
Please see the user manual on how to get this bug fixed!
http://www.taskjuggler.org/tj3/manual/Reporting_Bugs.html#Reporting_Bugs_and_Feature_Requests
*******************************************************************************

/var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/MessageHandler.rb:301:in `addMessage': RuntimeError (RuntimeError)
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/MessageHandler.rb:190:in `fatal'
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/MessageHandler.rb:312:in `fatal'
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/Tj3AppBase.rb:161:in `rescue in main'
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/taskjuggler/Tj3AppBase.rb:127:in `main'
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/lib/tj3.rb:16:in `<top (required)>'
	from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
	from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
	from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/taskjuggler-3.5.0/bin/tj3:4:in `<top (required)>'
	from /usr/local/bin/tj3:23:in `load'
	from /usr/local/bin/tj3:23:in `<main>'
```
This is due to a cyclic dependency between tasks A and B.

If I start reducing the project (remove depends
column4:
etc.) it starts to detect cycle deps:
```
$ tj3 bad.tjp
bad.tjp:38: Warning: Dependency loop detected at start of task B.b===84%===   ]
bad.tjp:38: Info: Loop ctnd. at end of task B.b
bad.tjp:23: Info: Loop ctnd. at start of task A.d
bad.tjp:23: Info: Loop ctnd. at end of task A.d
bad.tjp:7: Info: Loop ctnd. at end of task A
bad.tjp:30: Info: Loop ctnd. at start of task B
bad.tjp:38: Error: Aborting
```

So perhaps TJ should be fixed to always report loop instead of aborting?"

column1: {"issue":"quarters in quarterly ressource graph match the wrong months"
column2: body:"I played with the usual example project and introduced some copies of the resource graph. One monthly
column3: one weekly and one quarterly. Comparison between monthly and quarterly resource graph clearly show
column4: that the quarterly graph computes wrong numbers for the efforts.\r\n\r\nI would have added an example project
column5: but the issue tracker doesn't accept tgz-files. You can simply create an example yourself
column6:
if you take the asco project coming with the code as an example and change the resource graph from weekly to quarterly.

I also looked into the code and found the code line with the error:

```
git diff
diff --git a/lib/taskjuggler/TjTime.rb b/lib/taskjuggler/TjTime.rb
index 8f30b2e..9c44f3d 100644
--- a/lib/taskjuggler/TjTime.rb
+++ b/lib/taskjuggler/TjTime.rb
@@ -229
column13:
year = localtime.to_a


       sec = min = hour = 0
       day = 1
-      month = ((month - 1) % 3 ) + 1
+      month = ((month - 1) / 3 ) + 1
       TjTime.new([ year
column19:
0 ])
     end
```


When I use my locally changed tj3 script to "compile" the project
column20:
the quarterly resource graph is correct.


"

column2:
body:"The directory where `tj3client add` is run determines the project's working directory. This leads to problems when a different output directory is specified by `tj3ts_sender -d <dir>`. `tj3ts_sender` and most probably others like `tj3ts_summary` (which I didn't test though) will then fail with
```
> 2015-12-01 14:01:59 info tj3d[11308]: Generating report rl_21497214
> 2015-12-01 14:01:59 info tj3d[11308]: Report rl_21497214 generated in 0.021374637 seconds
> 2015-12-01 14:02:00 info tj3d[11318]: Generating report sheet_template_dw
> 2015-12-01 14:02:00 error tj3d[11318]: .:1: Cannot write to file ./TimeSheetTemplates/2015-12-06/dw_2015-12-06.tji.
> No such file or directory @ rb_sysopen - ./TimeSheetTemplates/2015-12-06/dw_2015-12-06.tji 
```
or similar. This can be reproduced with the following setup (figurative
column4:
no matter which directory
 2. Add a project like this
     ```bash

cd ~
tj3client add ~/projects/the-project/project.tjp
     ```
 3. Invoke the time sheet sender like this
    ```bash

tj3ts_sender -c ~/projects/the-project/project.tjrc -d ~/projects/the-project/
```

This will result in the above error.

The reason for this is: It seems that tj3d spawns a new process for each new project added with `tj3client add`. This tj3d subprocess' working directory equals the directory in which `tj3client add` was executed.

This behaviour is counterintuitive and fragile. The project's working directory should be set within a single location. 

A solutions to this could be:

Add a `-d` switch to `tj3client add` to set the project's output directory. If not set default to the path of the project's main `<project>.tjp`. Remove the `-d` option from `tj3ts_sender` and use the path provided during `tj3client add -d <dir> <project>.tjp`. This way the working directory is specified in a single location and remains consistent over all operations.

## References
 * [Discussion on TaskJuggler Users](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/taskjuggler-users/7JyvNu_s6C8)"

column3: but it made the issue (which seem to be somewhat common) go away.  The problem was my issue with tj3d.  I started with an absolutely fresh and up-to-date Fedora 21 installation (x86_64)
column4:
taskjuggler installed via RPM which automatically installed ruby with YAML support. 

> Kernel: 3.19.3-200.fc21.x86_64
> rubygem-taskjuggler-3.5.0-1.fc21
> ruby-2.1.5-26.fc21.x86_64

 tj3 works like a charm. I use it HEAVILY.  Trying to start using the tj3d and tj3webd functionality to take it to the next level
column5:
I tried for the first time to bring up tj3d with a project I spend more time working on that I should.  That failed.  I it would get stuck trying to import the project.  So I grabbed the tutorial.tjp and tried loading that.   This attempt failed as well.  So I started exploring and found that many folks have experienced similar issues.  There were some suggestions regarding the confirmation of YAML support.  Those tests passed for me.
```
$ ruby -r yaml -e "YAML::load_file('.taskjugglerrc')"
$ echo $?
0
```
So I attempted to throw tj3d into heavy debugging mode:
`tj3d -d -w --debug  -p 12345 -c .taskjugglerrc  tutorial.tjp`
I chose a crazy port that wasn't default so it would be easier to spot in the log files
The .taskjugglerrc was straight from the tutorial (just one level higher on the debugging):
```
$ cat .taskjugglerrc 
_global:
  authKey: topsecret
  webServerPort: 8080
  _log:
    logLevel: 4
    outputLevel: 4
```
Here is the stderr log file created during my last failed run:
```
$ cat tj3d.ps.2196.stderr

```

So
column6:
I went exploring the TjTime.rb file mentioned in the log file above.  Line 79 looks like it is trying to set the TZ environment variable.
```
77      # Restore TZ if it was set earlier.
78      if tz
79        ENV['TZ'] = tz
80      else
81        ENV.delete('TZ')
82      end
```
  I have never written a single line of ruby - ever.  I set and exported a TZ environment variable and achieved the same results as before - failure.   Looking closer at the stderr output I found this line and did a little more research about setting SAFE in ruby.
`Fatal: Insecure operation - []=`
Not knowing anything about anything
column7:
I then commented out line 79.  That's it.  Just commented it out.  I unset the previously set TZ environment variable.

The who.le show works now.  All tutorial examples work.  My large project file works with all of it's crazy includes and booking statement files.  The web interface works.  I am running the very simple .taskjugglerrc file as above and can run tj3d and tj3webd without any arguments - like I said straight from the tutorial.

This is just a fantastic project and want to help in any way I can.  I wouldn't call this a fix
column8: but it now causes everything that I know to try from the tutorial --- to work.  Maybe this will help others.\r\n\r\nPlease use the suggestion to alter TjTime.rb at your own risk.  I have only done basic testing
column9:
but wow...

Thank you to the group for all of your efforts.

By the way
column10: this is my first post / issue with my just created github account.  - so please flame me too hard for a newbie style post."

column1: {"issue":"[Feature request] sum duration of a set of tasks for time-dependent repeating tasks"
column2: body:"Horrible name... but I'm using tj to plan some time-sensitive experiments which have a set of steps that need to occur at the same intervals for repeatability. So
column3:
consider something like two repetitions of a task with slight variations to determine the effects of certain steps:

```
Batch 1
- step 1
- step 2
- wait n minutes
- step 3
- wait m minutes
- step 4
- test

Batch 2
- step 1
- step 2
- wait
- step 4
- test
```

I want to test Batch 2 such that the time between step 2 and testing is the same as for Batch 1
column7: I may update the step/wait times as I conduct the sample preparation
column8: and it would be awesome to programmatically update Batch 2 so I can easily figure out how long to wait. Sorry I can't go into more detail... work-related stuff. Think of it as chemistry related. Combining A + B in one step begins a reaction that starts changing properties. I want the same amount of time to occur between the combination and testing for Batch 2 so that I can isolate the effect of step 3 by comparing the results.\r\n\r\nHopefully that made sense. This is a combo feature request + request for any tips on doing this if it already exists. The problem with simply doing `!depends` attributes is that my schedule may not allow for prepping things immediately consecutive to one another... so there may be some other \"offset\" between the two batches."

column1: {"issue":"Style rolled-up tasks in task report as normal tasks"
column2: body:"I want to define tasks with both an effort (e.g. 1h) and a length (e.g. 1d)
column3: so I've set up container tasks with one effort sub-task and one length sub-task. I've also flagged the container tasks so that I can use `rolluptask` in the task report.\r\n\r\nIn the Gantt chart
column4: the rolled-up tasks are styled as normal tasks (which is what I want)
column5: but the rest of the table row is still styled as a container task (bold text
column6: container task icon). It would be great if the table row is styled as a normal task (regular text

column2: body:"Hi
column3:
I found something very illogical in the way tj3 handles vacations/leaves and working hours. The problem may be in the interval3 third format (+duration)

Example (sorry I tried to use the < code > thing but it failed) :


project test "TEST"  2014-07-16 +2m {
  	timezone "Europe/Paris"
  	timeformat "%Y-%m-%d"
  	dailyworkinghours 7
  	workinghours mon - fri 9:00 - 12:00
column7: told me he was taking 10days of vacations
column9: the logic would be to set his holidays as I did in the example. But it's all wrong because when my collegue took 10 days he was obvioulsy not counting the non working hours AKA saturday and sunday !!\r\n\r\nOne of the magical thing with a format like startdate +duration is that you don't care about calculating the end date. With tj3
column10: you have to calculate the enddate then substract with the startdate
column11: then put the number as a duration. There is no magic at all and the start +duration is totally useless ! And don't tell me that we should speak in real days instead of working days. The entire world speak in working days ;)\r\n\r\nWith leaves and vacations (and maybe some other keywords) the workinghours SHOULD be taken into consideration. It can lead to major confusion (as it did for me
column12: I had to rebuild my whole project
column13: with a calendar right next to me
column14:
it took me half a day...)

I understand the interval3 format is used elsewhere and this behaviour may not be generalized. You will probably have to rethink this to make it more logical for the users.

Amazing work by the way
column15: it's so far the best gantt tool I've ever tried. Keep going ! :)"
