column1: {"issue":"Mac MAMP PHP 5.4.X cast to String making crash"
column2:
body:"In the Lastest SDK s3.class.php get_canonical_user_id function:

````
return array(
			'id' => (string) $id->body->Owner->ID
body:"In many places in the PHP SDK max_retries is compared using the <= operator
column3: resulting in a max_retries of 0 meaning \"retry once\". I found this comparison in 5+ source files

column2: body:"sdk.class.php issues a call to unset() at the bottom of the file
column3: and unsets several variables. At the surface
column5: these are all in the global namespace and therefore conflict with the calling scope. \r\n\r\nA concrete example: I'm using the SDK in Drupal
column6: and their library loading mechanism uses a variable called $path in the vary part of the code that requires this file
column7: and it's in a loop (loading several of the files in this sdk). After including sdk.class.php
column8: the $path variable is no longer present and subsequent file paths can no longer be created.\r\n\r\nMy suggestion is to use 'aws' namespaced variables (and not necessarily the PHP Namespace feature
column10: but at least things like $aws_config_path instead of simply $path if you must use a global scope.\r\n\r\nCheers!"

column1: {"issue":"site-wide enhancements to info display & new features"
column2: body:"Big-picture list of enhancements for volunteers to tackle - on our open-source
column3: non-profit platform! \r\n\r\nBriefest background: AskThem was conceived primarily as a \"We the People\" for every U.S. elected official
column4: and secondarily for public figures with verified Twitter accounts. Stakeholder research showed that verifying a question-asker as a constituent was usually necessary to solicit a response
column5: so UI put visitors through an address-or-ZIP-lookup funnel before asking a question. Data limitations on elected official info played a role in what we were able to develop with tech lead @walter
column6: who's been incredible. \r\n\r\nGoals below are towards making it easier for new visitors to find their question target and publish through a question
column7: outside of the address-lookup funnel - relevant for user stories around
column9: the Presidential debates and major Twitter accounts.\r\n\r\n1. On homepage
column10: sitewide search for question recipients by name. If selected
column13: if a question-field on that page is possible. If elected official w/ frequent name
column14: they may require disambiguation. If a Twitter target in database
column15: go to AskThem page; If Twitter target not already in database
column16: ideally app would add that question recipient
column17: as it does now from question-asking process.  \r\n\r\n2. On question recipient pages
column18: display a text box for 100 character questions to that entity
column19: which then after entered flips to an email entry field. Question would display immediately but be nuked within 24 hours or less if email address isn't verified. Follow-up email from app would need to direct email recipient to /users/sign_up to complete registration. Optional
column20: sign-in buttons with FB & Twitter & G+.\r\n\r\n3. Currently
column21: elected official data is populated by a variety of API calls - hence
column22: elected pages are in three tabs
column23: for federal and state and city. Goal is to display all available elected officials in a state
column26: so visitors can find their target by scrolling to name. If a major U.S. city doesn't have municipal electeds
column27: goal is to offer a link to a process to submit them to our data partners. \r\n\r\n4. Easier UI for asking electeds to become AskThem verified
column28: free of charge. \r\n\r\n5. Dynamic signature thresholds
column29: tied to population of relevant jurisdiction - a stretch goal
column30: with some data analysis components. \r\n\r\n6. SEO enhancements for state legislator names
column31: pegged to Google Analytics results. \r\n\r\nInput welcome on above priorities. "

column1: {"issue":"widget design enhancements - seeking volunteer time on useful new tools"
column2: body:"Our non-profit AskThem project was fortunate to develop free question-asking widgets with the Knight Foundation Prototype Fund. \r\n\r\nWe had the goal of enabling visitors to ask a question through to AskThem from any participating web page
column3: while staying on that web page. After rounds of digital-media research and user testing
column4: we found that many users sought to ask questions to the authors of articles and celebrities mentioned in posts (often more so than their own elected officials).\r\n\r\nOur tech lead @walter developed two kinds of widgets
column6: which generates embeddable Javascript widget code for any web page. \r\n\r\nThe first is a Person widget - see [example](http://blog.askthem.io/blog/2015/08/06/ask-questions-to-2016-presidential-candidates/) - where the creator of the widget selects a specific question target: any elected official in our database
column7: or any non-private Twitter account (does not need to be Twitter-verified with a blue check). The visitor can click through and ask her own question
column8: or edit a pre-written default question set by the widget creator. Resulting questions also go through to the AskThem.io site for social sharing. \r\n\r\nThe second is an Address widget - see [example](http://blog.askthem.io/blog/2015/04/09/askthem-widgets-test-page/) - where a visitor enters her ZIP code or full street address
column9: then sees her elected officials: definitely federal
column11: and sometimes city-level (depending on full address info). \r\n\r\nGoal is to enhance the design of the widget windows themselves- open to input
column12: some starting points: \r\n\r\n1. On a page with an embedded widget
column13: when visitor clicks the \"get started\" button to launch the modal
column14: resulting window is a bit thin and large. Tightening up the design and solidifying the edges might be more appealing. \r\n\r\n2. I could use more examples of good widget design
column15: but a tighter version (albeit one that requires less text space for visitors to input question content) is by our siblings Fight For the Future
column16: at [BattleForTheNet](https://www.battleforthenet.com/). Code on [GitHub](https://github.com/fightforthefuture/battleforthenet-widget).\r\n\r\n3. Widget-builder page itself could then use some sample images
column18: public-benefit project with some volunteer design time? Your work could be used on major media sites for Q&A with Presidential candidates
column20: and more public figures such as the blog of Chris Hayes on MSNBC. Email me
column25: where I hang out in #opengovernment. Questions & more specific design notes welcome
column26: thanks for considering our good-questions project. "

column1: {"issue":"Closure in module config will cause fatal if config cache is enabled"
column2: body:"instead of putting it to module.config.php you can move all closures into Module.php methods getServiceConfig or getControllerConfig or seperate Factory class which implements FactoryInterface.\r\n\r\nin that case application with your module will be able to cache configuration and factories with closures will be loaded in your Module.php"
body:"Works in 2.3.3
column3: Disappears in 2.3.4.  Investigating what's changed with ZendFramework."

column2: body:"Added a default prefix of an underscore to all methods added to native prototypes.\r\n\r\nNote: After updating the tests
column3: all tests passed except the underscore.string test of _classify(). I then checked the original repo and noticed it wasn't passing there either - maybe due to some change in the latest version of Underscore? In any case
column4: I updated the test so it passes."

column2: body:"I added a method prefix
column3:
to make it clearer which methods are non-native and to avoid clashing with any future native methods:
https://github.com/mbrowne/probe/commit/1a8d6bf45a23052f8409ef03710cc5122b01e544

If you would be interested in incorporating this change
column4: let me know and I'll update the readme and submit a pull request.\r\n\r\nBTW I also made the non-native methods non-enumerable...maybe that's not needed
column5: but I was trying to address the concern mentioned [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/409) (\"This could cause unexpected issues with code iterating over native prototypes\")...of course code that iterates over native prototypes should probably account for the possibility that they were extended anyway
column6: so maybe it would actually be better with them being enumerable. Also I assumed ES5 is available; not sure if you preferred to keep it ES3-compatible."

column2:
body:"A list of components to include in the 3.1 release.

- [ ] Improved Breadcrumb (https://codyhouse.co/demo/breadcrumbs-multi-steps-indicator/index.html)
- [ ] ComboBox (and Multi-ComboBox)
- [ ] DataTable
- [ ] Slider
- [ ] Toolbar
- [ ] Tree

The following are components that should be handler in user-land and most likely not in Titon
column3:
but we'll keep track of it anyways.

- [ ] Card
- [ ] Chart
- [ ] DatePicker
- [ ] Directory
- [ ] Menu"

column2: body:"Instead of recreating the wheel (yet again)
column3: we should port the entire framework to React. At the time of writing
column4: there is no \"go to\" UI library for React yet
column5: and Titon Toolkit hopes to fill that role. All of the current components will be ported to React
column6: along with the inclusion of decorators
column9:
and even React functionality like prop types.

- [x] Accordion
- [x] Breadcrumb
- [ ] Button
- [ ] ButtonGroup
- [ ] Carousel
- [x] Checkbox (from InputCheckbox)
- [x] Divider
- [x] Drop
- [x] Flex
- [ ] Flyout
- [ ] Form
- [x] Grid
- [ ] Input
- [ ] InputGroup
- [ ] Label
- [x] LazyLoad
- [ ] Loader
- [x] Mask
- [ ] Matrix
- [ ] Modal
- [ ] Notice
- [x] OffCanvas
- [x] Pagination
- [ ] Pin
- [ ] Popover
- [x] Progress
- [x] Radio (from InputRadio)
- [x] Select (from InputSelect)
- [x] Step
- [x] Switch
- [x] Tab
- [ ] Table
- [ ] Toast
- [ ] Tooltip
- [ ] TypeAhead"

column2:
body:"When using Titon with webpack we have run into issues with different versions of jquery being reference by Titon due to the "~2.2" version target. 

If "jquery" is changed to a peer dependency then we can specify the version we require and prevent multiple references to jquery being included in our bundle.

https://nodejs.org/en/blog/npm/peer-dependencies/"

column1: {"issue":"[3.0] Rewrite the Matrix using an adjacency matrix"
column2: body:"If we use an adjacency matrix data structure for the matrix component
column3: we could easily handle scenarios where multi-sized tiles can be appropriately placed."

column2: body:"Either through Flow (may have better React integration) or TypeScript."

column1: {"issue":"[3.0] Use CSS transform for animation when applicable"
column2: body:"Based on the following: http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/speed/high-performance-animations/"
body:"Both of these packages do something similar
column3: they provide shared functionality for other packages. In almost all cases
column4: all other packages require either one of these
column6:
so it might make sense to combine them into a single package.

Plan of action:
- Move `Common` interfaces to `Common\Contract`
- Move `Utility` classes to `Common\Utility`
- Move `Utility\State` to `Common\State`
- Remove Utility package"

column2: body:"Add Less support by utilizing a Sass -> Less transpiler. Our code isn't *too* complicated for this not to work."
body:"Focused elements should be function the same when the enter button is hit as if it was a click. For example
column3: accordion headers being focused and enter is pressed."

column2: body:"Right now the event layer uses a nested map with a priority level. Would probably be a better idea to use a MinHeap and treat it like a Priority Queue."

column1: {"issue":"Update the HTTP package to support the newer PSR-7"

column1: {"issue":"Implement Data Mapper pattern instead of Active Record"
column2: body:"Opening this issue to discuss how the Model layer is going to be implemented.\r\n\r\nI propose we implement the Data Mapper [1] pattern instead of the currently planned Active Record pattern. I say this because that while the Active Record pattern may be easy at first and faster to implement
column3: it violates the single responsibility principle in that it concerns itself with both domain logic and persistence [2]. Also as Titon is a framework
column4: it needs to be as flexible as possible so decoupling is key.\r\n\r\nTo go along with the Data Mapper pattern
column5: there is also usually a service layer. All this service layer does is marry domain objects to their data mappers and are the end-user interface. You would then use a service in
column7: the controller layer [3].\r\n\r\nThis whole pattern adds extra complexity through layers of abstraction
column8:
but it is much more extensible and testable. Thoughts?

1: http://martinfowler.com/eaaCatalog/dataMapper.html
2: http://russellscottwalker.blogspot.com/2013/10/active-record-vs-data-mapper.html
3: http://www.slideshare.net/aaronsaray/enterprise-php-mappers-models-and-services"

body:"Fixed auto-linking issue under win32:

Boost uses autolinking mechanism (if compiler supports this feature). Also boost sets special prefixes and suffixes for libraries (for example: **libbost_filesystem-vc90-mt-gd_1_53.lib**).This issue occurs only with compiler which support auto-link (e.g. msvc). Also i checked that gcc toolchain still works.

This request adds support for boost library naming

column1: {"issue":"Figure out how setup.py should actually work"
column2: body:"Right now we're installing in-development versions of distutils2 and pip by making them submodules and integrating their package installation into our setup.py.  That's not really appropriate.  There should be a way to get them both to be installed as dependencies rather than carrying them around as submodules
column3: but I don't really understand distutils and setuptools and pip well enough to know how that should be done.  distutils2 seems to be particularly troublesome because\n\n1. its setup.py doesn't respond to the `bdist_egg` command
column4: and ours tries to use that command on it during installation.\n2. its setup.py is located in a subdirectory
column5: so it isn't naturally found by setuptools.\n"

column2: body:"Probably we should run BuildBot
column4: and CDash at least.  We're not yet sure what will work best for Ryppl"

body:"Boost has already been modularized in http://gitorious.org/boost.  However
column3: these modules don't bring along the Boost development history.\n\nI think if we want to keep the history
column4: we need to remake each of these repos a clone of http://gitorious.org/boost/svn
column5: which is automatically tracking our SVN repository
column6: then make the changes required to modularize the repo
column7: so we'll be able to continue pulling changes in from our Git SVN mirror.  I think it's important to make these changes fine-grained
column8: so you don't move/rename _and_ modify a file in a single commit
column9: so that Git can succeed with later merges.  It would be a good idea if each module contained a script (or other record) of the exact steps required to create and update it."

for f in *.dvi; do dvips $f; done
This is dvips(k) 5.96 Copyright 2005 Radical Eye Software (www.radicaleye.com)

body:"Someone needs to make sure everything works on Win64.  This is a bit tricky as one commonly ends up with a mix of 32- and 64- bit binaries
column3: and the usual assumptions about `\\Program Files\\ ` don't apply because 32-bit programs are in `\\Program Files (x86)\\ `.  How that mix is divided can vary per-installation
column4: but I'm not sure we can test all of those configurations.  It will be up to you to make sure we don't make any obviously incorrect assumptions and to test and maintain at least one easily-installed 64-bit setup."

column2: body:"When branches become empty in Git
column3: it's usually because they have been deleted in SVN.  We should leave a tag on the ref's final commit before becoming empty

column2: body:"The original svn2git codebase could restart the conversion process where it left off for cases when SVN is just receiving new commits.  This is not hard to implement
column3: but not necessarily required for Boost"

column2: body:"Instead of traversing the SVN filesystem
column3: do it by examining SVN subtree rules (patrie has a method for this).  Not sure whether this is actually a bottleneck

column2: body:""

body:"Some examples of issues that should be considered:\r\n\r\n* We have lots of refs beginning with `old-branches/`.  I believe that name was chosen originally by @jwiegley because either the branch had been deleted (in which case we can let svn2git handle that using its `backups/` feature) or because it is not being actively developed.  IIRC in that case he was directing the old branch at a tag
column3: which we are not currently doing.\r\n\r\n* there are lots of duplicate ref name suffixes in SVN
column4: some of which are being collapsed to the same tag in git.  This mostly happens in the Boost.Build repo
column7: `/tags/jam/`<whatever> and `/tags/tools/jam/<whatever>`.  It seems likely that these tags were all simply moved/re-rooted... ah
column9: see [r39733](http://ci.boost.org/svn-trac/changeset/39733).  In a case like that
column11: but we should try to be sure of it."

column2: body:"I think the problem addressed by 9402466a7 could be detected at ruleset processing time.  It took hours to debug.  Could you add error detection for this?"

column3: but otherwise we want to make sure that ancestry isn't dropped."

column1: {"issue":"SQLyog looks weird on high dpi display."
column2:
body:"Original [issue 2073](https://code.google.com/p/sqlyog/issues/detail?id=2073) created by webyog on 2015-01-07T13:24:53.000Z:

I have attached screenshots of SQLyog on 2880*1800 display.

Problem--
 Images are very small.
 Text are clipped.
 Controls are overlapped or have become smaller.
 Html content have become smaller.
 Watermark of different wizard are not scaled properly.

Solution--
Make SQLyog DPI aware.
Instead of using static size use scaling based on current DPI.
Design toolbar icon and other icons in larger size also.

Current maximum size is 32*32.

optimal Size of icons on different DPI are-
96 DPI: 32x32
120 DPI: 40x40
144 DPI: 48x48
192 DPI: 64x64
240 DPI: 80x80

Supporting upto 240 dpi will be enough I guess.

I have attached a screenshot of SQLyog when I forcefully stretch the toolbar icons to 64*64 pixels.

It seems that Visual Studio 10 is also not dpi aware. It also has same problems as SQLyog. Toolbar icons are stretched and become blurry. I have attached screenshot of visual studio also.
 
"

column1: {"issue":"SQLyog query editor doesn't behave same as other famous editors if word wrap is enabled and END key is pressed."
column2:
body:"Original [issue 2070](https://code.google.com/p/sqlyog/issues/detail?id=2070) created by webyog on 2014-12-24T05:54:09.000Z:

Refer forums-http://forums.webyog.com/index.php?showtopic=7579&hl=

User says-
"For purposes of this topic
column3: I'll use the term "visual end" to refer to the last character of a line of text that fits on a single row in the editor. If the editor can fit 80 columns in the display then on a line of 100 characters
column4:
the visual end is column 80 of that line.
 
"Actual end" is the end of a line of text - the ending LF or CRLF character. 
 
In the SQLyog editor
column6: pressing the end key moves the cursor to the actual end of the line.  This causes a bit of frustration when editing.  In every other editor that I use
column7: the end key moves the cursor to the visual end of the line rather than the actual end.  Not a huge problem
column8: but would be nice if SQLyog acted consistently with other editors.""

column2: body:"This is a request to support MongoDB.\r\n\r\nI use Holland for mysql already and would really like to use it for MongoDB as the scripts I see out there just do not have what this offers."

body:"INSTALL needs a lot of work to bring it up to speed.  Particularly the reference to using ./scripts/mkvirtualenv.py is probably very broken today.  This needs to reference our packages in EPEL and walk through an install using virtualenv and friends."

body:"I should have put these in two pulls but basically worked on 2 things:

rsync plugin:

For doing differential style backups using rsync
column3: leveraging hard-links. I'm not trying to pressure this to go into mainline but wasn't sure otherwise how best to handle it as a 3rd party plugin outside of the tree. I've been using it for a while now for my own backups
column4: though I'd consider this beta. Additionally
column5: it could use some extra features (such as a way to set nice/ionice
column6:
although I wonder if that may be useful as a holland core config option).

Docs:

I didn't like how we were organizing provider configuration information under the main configuration section. Instead
column7: I pulled out providers into their own section
column8: where we can elaborate on what they do
column9: and put references to them in the config section instead. I think it is much better.\r\n\r\nBoth of these are merely proposals. Probably worthy of more discussion in holland-discuss
column10: but since I was going out of town for the weekend
column11: I thought I'd go ahead and toss this out in case if was needed.\r\n"

column2:
body:"Tim's documentation request made me think about this.  These sorts of changes would be introduced in a major version bump rather than 1.0.X.

There's a few issues with backup-commands:

 - after-backup-command only runs on successful backups.  This should have probably been called 'successful-backup-command' or something along those lines
 - backup commands don't consistently have access to the configuration.  before-backup-command is currently run before a backup.conf exists
column3: and it's ugly to extract things from an ini config anyway\r\n - backup commands inherit the environment of holland itself
column4:
which can change depending on how its run (i.e. $PWD is pretty useless to rely on).

There really should be four stages of hook commands:

  - before-backup -> run after local backup directory and config is available but before plugin is called
  - failed-backup-command -> run if a backup fails
  - successful-backup-command -> run only if a backup succeeds
  - after-backup -> unconditionally run after the backup regardless of failure (unless holland is terminated with prejudice)

I think the environment should be setup more consistently.  Some environment variables I think might be useful offhand:

 - HOLLAND_BACKUP_DIRECTORY (i.e. /var/spool/holland/$name/YYMMdd_HHMMSS/)
 - HOLLAND_BACKUPSET (i.e. 'default')
 - HOLLAND_BACKUP_CONFIG -> I think a json encoded blob of the (validated) python dict config may make sense here so a backup command can do something useful with it.
 - HOLLAND_BACKUP_EVENT -> {before
column7: successful}-backup\r\n\r\nThese basically map to the template variables holland 1.0.x documents today ($backupdir
column9: $backupset).  I imagine other information might make sense here as well (HOLLAND_VERSION
column10: etc.).\r\n\r\nAdditionally I think holland should run these commands with cwd = ${backupdir} by default
column11: rather than just relative to whatever cwd holland was started with.  That makes it easy if the purpose it to change some file in the backup directory (i.e. ```touch my_status_file``` vs. ```touch $backupdir/my_status_file```)\r\n\r\nPerhaps other sanitizing of the environment makes sense here too."

column2: body:"https://github.com/holland-backup/holland/issues/99\r\n\r\nAdd pid to logs to make parsing easier while multiple backupsets overlap"
body:"Currently
column3: if I want to force the single-transaction lock method on one database
column4: but continue using auto-detect (default) on the other databases
column5: I have to create two backupsets:\r\n1) Force single-transaction and include only the target database.\r\n2) Use the default auto-detect lock-method
column6: and backup all database except the target database.\r\n\r\nIt would be nice if I could continue using only one backupset and specific within the config to force a particular lock-method on a specific database
column7: but use the default on all others.\r\n\r\nI guess ultimately I'm asking for both a global and a database-level setting for lock-method (and potentially for any other arguments for which this makes sense).  The global setting would be required (or default to auto-detect)
column8: and the database-level setting would override the global."

column2: body:"Andy and I both agreed having a documentation that provides a more scenario-based overview of which provider to use when might prove helpful for users that do not already know which method is the best choice under what scenario.\r\n\r\nMight also be a good place to make mention of some edge cases (such as how to backup TokuDB) and gotchas of using various providers."
body:"Holland LVM plugins are least are lacking support for GTIDs.  mysqldump and xtrabackup should include this by default in most cases
column3: but I haven't tested holland restores with GTIDs in mind.\r\n\r\nThis should be pretty simple to add.  I would like to support both MariaDB and MySQL 5.6+ GTID implementations.  There should be some good improvements in holland's  LVM support  soon and this can ride on those changes.  This sort of feature will probably be introduced in a major version bump."

column2:
body:"MySQL bug http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=70307 can lead to a deadlock condition on MySQL 5.6 with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK+ SHOW SLAVE STATUS.  I have been bitten by this in production in the past.

This bug can be worked around by simply stopping the slave prior to running SHOW SLAVE STATUS - and probably just recording gtid info instead is not as racy.  This requires specific support for that in holland.  I propose just adding a stop-slave option for this to the LVM plugin.

As a side note
column3: this same issue exists in some configurations with Percona-Server 5.6.20 and below when using Percona's backup locks feature.  This was recently fixed in 5.6.21.  Holland doesn't support backup locks yet but it should for at least the LVM plugins."

column2: body:"There have been a few occasions where backup data has been corrupted after the fact
column3: usually after shuffling through various long-term storage services.  Sometimes those use deduplication features or other complex transformations that don't always interact well with all file formats.  It is often difficult to tell where the corruption was introduced - whether holland did something wrong
column4: or the source data was already bad or bit rot was introduced during shuffling data around.\r\n\r\nTo combat this
column5:
I would like to see checksums (optionally) generated after a successful backup so backup files can be easily verified later.  This is relatively cheap to calculate even for large backups and can be disabled if problematic.

I propose one new option to support this feature:

```
[holland:backup]
checksum-algorithm = option(none
column10:
default="md5")
```

Where "none" disables the feature entirely.  md5 is going to be the fastest and probably good enough here
column11:
but perhaps holland should default to one of the more robust sha variants.

This feature should write a CHECKSUMS file to the backup directory after successful backup by a plugin.  Paths should be relative to the backup directory so one can simply verify via:

```
$ cd path
$ md5sum -c < CHECKSUMS
```"

column2: body:"I think holland should give up on trying to estimate backup sizes.  It's a hard problem to do this accurately in the face of compression or other transformations and it can be expensive to calculate.  This complicates the code in non-trivial ways in various places as well\r\n\r\nI do think some guard to avoid exhausting disk space is important - particularly when backup space is shared with some other critical resource (often the database being backed up).  I think instead of estimation
column3: some basic disk space monitoring should be done.  So rather than aborting if we expect a backup to be too large
column4:
holland should rather abort only if disk space falls too low.  This is fairly simple to do with a background thread that just sits in a loop polling statvfs(2) periodically and signaling holland to abort when this falls below some threshold.

I propose three new configuration options to support this with the following tentative naming conventions and default values:

```
[holland:backup]
disk-space-monitor = boolean(default=yes)   # flag to enable/disable monitoring disk space
disk-space-monitor-required-space = filesize(default="5G")  # If the space falls below this threshold
column5:
abort
disk-space-monitor-interval = float(default=1.0) # interval in seconds between checks
```

Required space will be compared against available space based on statvfs(2) of the backup directory's mountpoint - the same mechanism holland currently uses to compare estimated space vs. space available.

As far as signaling holland
column6: I think sending a process the signal SIGUSR1 to force and abort makes sense for now.  This works on environments where holland is currently supported.  Holland can install an appropriate signal handler to fail gracefully in this case."

column2: body:"Feature request - Sometimes it takes so long to backup MySQL data that the first backup is still running when the next fires off.  When this happens
column3: the logs become cluttered with multiple start and stop messages in the middle of the log output from the original backup that's still running.  This makes it very difficult to pull all the logs from just that one job that ran for 30 hours.\r\n\r\nA solution would be to include a job ID on every log entry in the holland log.  We could then simply grep for that job ID to get all logs relevant to that single run
column4: without all the clutter of other jobs trying to run."

column2: body:"I'd like the abilty to run a command to only verify that holland is able to access the MySQL instance.  \"holland bk --dry-run\" will do this
column3:
but it also does some number crunching that uses system resources and delays the command's return. I'd like the ability to run something like "holland cred-test" and get output like the following: 
Authenticate to MySQL.....OK
Perm: SELECT.....OK
Perm: RELOAD.....OK
Perm: SUPER.....OK
Perm: LOCK TABLES.....OK
Perm: REPLICATION CLIENT.....ERROR
Perm: SHOW VIEW.....OK
And of course

column2: body:"Feature request:\r\nThis is currently possible by manually editing the exclude options passed to tar
column3: but that leaves room for user error.  Also
column4: if the goal is to backup only one database
column5: then that exclude option to [tar] requires a manual adjustment every time a new DB is added to MySQL.  Ideally
column6: I could pass an include argument to holland-mysqllvm
column7: and Holland would programmatically generate a list of files to specifically include in the tar command ($datadir/$db/$table.*
column11: etc) or alternatively generate an exclude list for tar based on what's not included in the Holland config.\r\n\r\nThis option should probably come with a commented warning that excluding InnoDB tables has limited benefit based on whether innodb_file_per_table is in use or not."

```

2 files in cluster 1 (1920 bytes

./dcserialize/biedrzycki_akslop.xml

column2: body:"Plugins should be able to send arbitrary messages. To achieve this
column3: they'll need a reference to the Bot object or some of its methods. However
column4: it's not possible to pass new parameters to a plugin constructor without breaking backwards compatibility.\n\nTo solve this
column5:
I propose:

* Adding a getter/setter to the Plugin base class.
* Calling this from the BotFactory after a plugin is instantiated
column6: to give it a reference to `Bot().msg()`.\n\nThis technique can be used in future to pass more data into a plugin."

body:"Define:

column1: {"issue":"link to this GitHub repo on the website"
column2: body:"Probably the link should be by the license notice.\r\n\r\nConsider also *mirroring* to a fully-free/libre/open repository for those who object to using GitHub (which is proprietary). Here's a list of places to consider mirroring: https://snowdrift.coop/p/snowdrift/w/en/formats-repositories#fully-flo-source-hosting"

body:"I really think there's a general problem with the term \"users\" and \"users' rights\" and such. It doesn't sound dignified. It's just one step removed from \"consumers\". It doesn't treat people as full actors in our society
column3: and I don't think we should be recommending it.\r\n\r\nBetter terms are those like \"people\" and \"citizens\"."

column1: {"issue":"added sentence about limited time vs moral rights"
column2: body:""

column1: {"issue":"more nuanced wording of free vs open"
column2: body:"Free and Open are identical sets of licenses for FSF and OSI for example. That is not always true
column3: but we can't easily say that free licenses and open licenses are different when 99% of the time they are the same licenses. We need to focus on the values."

column1: {"issue":"better wording with examples of \"restriction\" vs protection"
column2: body:""
body:"It is a bad way to talk. We need to talk about freedom of people. Consider Corey Doctorow's emphasis that information does *not* want to be free
column3: don't personify information.\r\n\r\nWhereas I strongly want my other pull requests merged
column4: I'm less strong about this one. It's good it was in quotes at least. But I think removing this is an improvement."

column2: body:"a few oxford commas
column4: removed some junk that was unneeded

column2: body:"emphasized \"law\" to clarify that this is a legal detail
column3: also more consistent with new proposed discussion of copyright as emphasizing the legal facts about it."

column1: {"issue":"reframed copyright as being the right to copy…"
column2: body:"Thus
column3: we point out that copyright law is about *limiting* this right.\r\n\r\nNote that besides this being a better framing
column4: the original had a giving-up clause that said \"we don't have much choice\" which is crappy."

column1: {"issue":"update to CC license v4 instead of v3"
column2: body:"v4 is better internationally
column4: v3 has an update clause anyway"

body:"Hi.

I just installed cucumis 1.0.17 with npm. There were 2 unsatisfied dependencies: eyes@0.1.6 and vows@0.5.13 . I installed them manually and cucumis started to work. 
I looked into package.json in the repo and noticed that eyes@0.1.6. is still missing (while vows are already in place). So I added eyes.

Regards
body:"Related to this issue:\r\n\"beforeTest
column3:
afterTest need longer timeouts"
https://github.com/noblesamurai/cucumis/issues/20

This replaces the hard-coded timeout value with the variable configurable with cucumis -t
"

column2: body:"@noblesamurai Love the initiative that you have taken on getting this project off the ground! I'm not sure if you're aware
column3: but there is an open issue in [kyuri](http://github.com/nodejitsu/kyuri) for making a better `kyuri` binary: https://github.com/nodejitsu/kyuri/issues/10\r\n\r\nThoughts?"

column2: afterTest need longer timeouts"
column3: body:"Both beforeTest and afterTest may be doing more expensive setup/takedown that need a longer time to run.  For example
column4: to set up a selenium browser session (via soda)
column5: takes around 4 seconds on my computer.\r\n\r\nI could put this in a \"Background:\" step and then use cucumis -t
column6: but (a) sometimes it can take longer
column7: and go past even the default 5s timeout of the async step (requiring a 'regular' custom command line or creating a script) and (b) I don't want a new session for each feature
column8: as this unnecessarily slows down the testing.\r\n\r\nThe most crude solution is to simply increase the timeout on cucumis.js from 100ms to 10000ms in these cases.  After all
column9: if you actually have to kill a step for taking too long
column10: this is a testing error and probably needs attention.  I can imagine a more elegant solution where you can specify a timeout.  Ideally this would be programmatic to avoid custom command lines.  \r\n\r\nI'm happy to write something along these lines and submit if this is the desired solution
column11: or we can just increase the timeout.   Thoughts?"

column1: {"issue":"How can I express 3rd week of november"
column2: body:"Looking for a way to express timeframe like this. Is it something that datejs do or can implement"

body:"`Date.parse('tomorrow at 3pm') //tomorrow 3AM`
`Date.parse('tomorrow at 15:00') //tomorrow 3PM`
`Date.parse('tomorrow at 15') //tomorrow 00:00AM`
`Date.parse('tomorrow at 15pm') //tomorrow 15PM`

Hi
column4:
sometimes PM/AM have an effect and sometimes they don't.

Should `Date.parse('tomorrow at 3pm')` return `tomorrow 15:00` or is `tomorrow 03:00` the expected behaviour?

Thanks"

body:"Hi there 

I have had some issue trying to Parse dates in April. Any thing in April always comes out to 
01 April [whatever year]

I have noticed others have had similar issue I have had to start Parsing Dates `yyyy-MM-dd`
Not a major issue. but my trust in Date.JS has been shaken. 
What do I do if parsing by  `yyyy-MM-dd` starts to Not work??


"
body:"_From @GoogleCodeExporter on April 18
column3:
2015 5:51_

```
Note:
This issue relates to a nightly-build of Firefox 3.1
column4:
so it may not warrent
any action just yet since it could change again before the actual release
of 3.1. I'm posting it here though just in case though.


What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Using Firefox 3.1b2pre (>= nightly build for 10-20-2008):
2. var d = new Date();
3. d.toISOString()

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

expected:
~ ""2008-10-21T15:06:31Z""

see:
~ "2008-10-21T15:06:11.324Z"

What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?
Firefox 3.1b2pre (nightly build for 10-20-2008)

Please provide any additional information below.
This issue only started occurring in 3.1 as far as I know since the
10-20-2008 nightly build. The result of the switch is that some code used
to drop the extra quotation marks (slice(1
column5:
-1)) now drops important parts
of the date.
```

column1: {"issue":"toString() method has conflicts with the optional radix native paramter"
column2: body:"As I experimented the native Date.prototype.toString method has an optional parameter named radix which must be an integer between 2 and 36 (Which base to use for representing a numeric value) but in the toString() override the code never asumpts that we can receive a numeric value
column3: so if we receive it the code tries to call 8.replace which returns TypeError: format is not a function.\r\n\r\nYou can check this by calling: (new Date()).toString(8);"

_Copied from original issue: datejs/DateJS#16_"

column2: body:"_From @GoogleCodeExporter on April 18
column3:
2015 5:50_

```
Safari 2's implementation of Date#setDate uses a signed byte integer which
means large values will get 'rolled over' and return an incorrect value
unless the add/subtracts are called in increments. The following link
details this bug which affects the addition methods that use setDate. This
issue does not affect Safari 3.

http://brianary.blogspot.com/2006/03/safari-date-bug.html

I tested using the version installed at http://www.datejs.com/
```

column2:
body:"Hi.
We're moving to java8 and having problems with validate-lib.

Current version of validate-lib project has a dependency to Saxon-he version 9.4.

When using saxon-he version prior to 9.5.1.5 with jdk8 I get lots of errors  saying:

estSetVersionAndIdentifier(no.difi.vefa.validation.DetectVersionAndIdentifierTest): XPathFactory#newInstance() failed to create an XPathFactory for the default object model: http://java.sun.com/jaxp/xpath/dom with the XPathFactoryConfigurationException: javax.xml.xpath.XPathFactoryConfigurationException: java.util.ServiceConfigurationError: javax.xml.xpath.XPathFactory: jar:file:/Users/adammscisz/.m2/repository/net/sf/saxon/Saxon-HE/9.5.0.1/Saxon-HE-9.5.0.1.jar!/META-INF/services/javax.xml.xpath.XPathFactory:2: Illegal configuration-file syntax

When I upgrade Saxon-he to higher version (e.g. 5.1.5.8 or 6.4) 2 tests fail in validate-lib:

testMain(no.difi.vefa.validation.FilterMessageTest): expected:<2> but was:<1>
testMain(no.difi.vefa.validation.SchematronTransformationTest): expected:<1> but was:<0>

Could you prepare a version/tag/branch with jdk8 support?

Regards
body:"Hia
column3:
# Introduction
In regards to our usage of the DIFI-application
column4: we have made several changes to the application in order to make it better
column5: more stable and more verbose in regards to services and easyness related to transferability between servers and environment. This is a small list of what we have changed to make it a bit better:\r\n\r\n* Everything is now Java 8
column6: converted some portions with lambdas etc.\r\n* SOAP Ws
column7: we were unable to use the REST-like services which were already implemented. Our internal infrastructure is not ready for REST
column8: however SOAP is supported. Added support for this.\r\n* Jetty Embedded jar-file instead of container-based WAR-file. This renders the generated library totally independant from other sources and requirements that implies that a container must be in place in order to deploy this. This simplifies the process of both moving the deployment between servers
column9: and also lessens the errors which may occur (one container
column10:
less errors.
* Web-part included in the pom-file of the validator-ws module.
* Fixed failing tests

Regards

column1: {"issue":"Åpne for å kunne laste sertifikat fra StoreLocation.LocalMachine"
column2: body:"I følge guide for .NET-klient for integrasjons med Difi’s Oppslagstjeneste skal avsendersertifikat installeres på Current User. Ser og at Api-Client-Shared har koden `X509Store x509Store = new X509Store(StoreName.My
column3: StoreLocation.CurrentUser);` for å finne sertifikatet. Er det med hensikt at det er valgt Current User
column4: eller er det en glipp?\r\n\r\nDrift her har problem med å installere sertifikat på appol-brukeren. Når de følger guide på http://difi.github.io/oppslagstjeneste-klient-dotnet/v5.3/
column5: blir sertifikat installert på administrator.\r\n\r\nDe mener det ville være mer naturlig å installere på maskinkonto. Ved å installere sertifikat i current user fungerer det dersom website kjører som vanlig bruker (for eksempel admin)
column6: men de ser ikke det som god praksis.\r\n\r\nBlir sertifikat installert på maskinkonto kan følgende brukes i programkoden (hvertfall som fallback dersom sertifikat ikke blir funnet på Current User: `X509Store x509Store = new X509Store(StoreName.My
column7: StoreLocation.LocalMachine); ` Prøvde å lage lokal kopi av _api-client-shared_
column8: men dessverre for min test (men korrekt) kreves det rett PublicKeyToken på dll
column9: slik at min test ikke virket.\r\n\r\nHar dere veiledning for å installere sertifikat på appol bruker
column10: eller er det mulig å få oppdatering på _api-client-shared_ så den kan bruke sertifikat på maskinkonto?\r\n\r\n"

column1: {"issue":"Ønsker mulighet for å stoppe requester til feil miljø"
column2:
body:"Vi opplever at flere avsender i sin testing blander mellom det funksjonelle testmiljøet og produksjon.
Klientbiblioteket har informasjon om et sertifikat er et gyldig produksjonssertifikat eller ikke og kan dermed stoppe requestene før de sendes og gi en fornuftig feilmelding/exception tilbake til utvikler/tester.

Klientbiblioteket må ta høyde for følgende ved innføring av en slik mekanisme:
- Det er forskjellige lenker til produksjon for vanlige integrasjon og integrasjon fra norsk helsenett
- Det er forskjellige sertifikater som kan benyttes
column3:
både commifdes og buypass.


Det er flere måter å sjekke om sertifikatet kan brukes mot produksjonsmiljøet eller ikke.
Det som blir mest korrekt er å sjekke klient sertifikatets policy
column4:
her skal det være referanse til en av de følgende OID'ene:

- 2.16.578.1.29.13.1.1.0 (commifdes)
- 2.16.578.1.26.1.3.2 (buypass soft tokens)
- 2.16.578.1.26.1.3.5 (buypass hard tokens)

I test brukes andre sertifikat policer.

referanser til sertifikat policyene til leverandørene:

- Buypass certificate policy: http://www.buypass.no/kundeservice/nedlastingssenter/_attachment/26270?_ts=1505bfe4d20
- Commfides certificate policy: https://www.commfides.com/images/stories/artikler/Installasjon_av_CPN_RootCA_SHA256_Class_3/cn-cp_01_certificate%20policy%20for%20commfides%20sha256%20class3%20enterprise%20certificates.pdf

Denne forbedringen ønskes også i .net klientbiblioteket (https://github.com/difi/sikker-digital-post-klient-dotnet
column6: men tenker at det kan spesifiseres opp her først og så realiseres i begge bibliotek)."

column1: {"issue":"standard varsling som settes opp er i ikke i henhold til det som anbefales for Avsendere som skal varsle"
column2:
body:"I https://github.com/difi/sikker-digital-post-java-klient/blob/master/src/main/java/no/difi/sdp/client/domain/digital_post/EpostVarsel.java er standard at det settes opp ett varsel samtidig som brevet blir tilgjengeliggjort for mottaker.

Avsendere sitt bruk av varslinger er styrt av eForvaltningsforskriften §8a (http://lovdata.no/dokument/SF/forskrift/2004-06-25-988/KAPITTEL_2#%C2%A78) og dokumentert her: http://begrep.difi.no/SikkerDigitalPost/1.2.0/begrep/Varsler

Dersom klientbiblioteket overhode skal ha noe default varslingsinstillinger så bør det være i henhold til eForvaltningsforskriften og dermed være 0
column3:
7

Vi har eksempler på virksomheter som har satt opp varsling slik:
- DigitalPost.Builder postBuilder = …
postBuilder.epostVarsel(EpostVarsel.builder(epostadresse
column5:
om noen som vil bestille varsling kun ved tilgjengeliggjøring.



 "

column2:
body:"Har opplevd å få følgende feilmelding:

`no.difi.sdp.client.domain.exceptions.SendException: An unhandled exception occured while performing request
        at no.difi.sdp.client.internal.DigipostMessageSenderFacade.performRequest(DigipostMessageSenderFacade.java:142)
        at no.difi.sdp.client.internal.DigipostMessageSenderFacade.performRequest(DigipostMessageSenderFacade.java:123)
Caused by: no.difi.sdp.client.domain.exceptions.NoekkelException: Klarte ikke å verifisere signatur på responsen. Dette kan skyldes at det tiltrodde rotsertifikatet mangler i keystore/trust store. Hvis dette plutselig begynner å skje kan det skyldes at den andre parten har skiftet sertifikat
        at no.difi.sdp.client.internal.UserFriendlyWsSecurityExceptionMapper.resolveException(UserFriendlyWsSecurityExceptionMapper.java:27)
        at org.springframework.ws.soap.security.AbstractWsSecurityInterceptor.handleValidationException(AbstractWsSecurityInterceptor.java:299)

body:"Hi
column3: \r\n\r\nwe have a few parties developing systems to work with or using Oxalis
column4: and some of them do not have PEPPOL (test) certificates yet
column5:
or may not have them at all (since they will not be running the access points themselves as a third party). In order to improve the interoperability testing in an early phase it would be very nice to be able to test with a local PKI in a group that has short lines and quick communication.

I have a patch in my fork that adds a third operational mode 'PRIVATE'; this enables a configuration option oxalis.truststore where a local truststore can be set apart from the existing production and test truststores. It can be found in https://github.com/tjeb/oxalis/tree/private_truststore

Would you consider that a useful addition in the mainline? If so
column6: I can make a pull request; the current branch is based on tag oxalis-3.2.0 which is what we are running
column7: but I could clean it up and base it on master as well. Related to that
column8: are there any new releases planned for 3?"

column1: {"issue":"For incoming document in peppol the endpoint id value is getting wrongly saved in BD"
column2:
body:"Step to replicate :-
1) Send 1 simpler invoice file without SBDH from oxalis standalone
2) The file is sent successfully
3) The value that Oxalis is saving in the header is NOT correct. Instead of the AccountingCustomerParty.EndpointID it is saving the AccountingCustomerParty.Party.PartyLegalEntity.CompanyID

Here the file "XmlData.xml
[OxalisSampleFile.zip](https://github.com/difi/oxalis/files/258673/OxalisSampleFile.zip)

" is the file which is sent without SBDH and
the file which oxalis creats after adding SBDH header is AddingSBDH.xml"
body:"This issue was also raised in issue 219
column3: and closed with he comment:\r\n'The Exception is tracked back to code in rt.jar
column4: indicating content-type as lowercase is the de facto standard.'\r\n\r\nHowever
column5: that statement conflict with the fact that content type as case sensitive has been reported as a bug with severity Major: https://java.net/jira/browse/JAX_WS-1176?jql=text%20~%20%22XmlDataContentHandler%22\r\n\r\nI see two options. Either wait for Java to fix the bug and release a new version of the jax-ws library
column6: making the content type case insensitive. Or make our own implementation
column7:
and thereby making the content type case insensitive.

The implementation of the class containing the bug can be seen here at github: https://github.com/gf-metro/jaxws/blob/282759e2b822078de9ba78c743ed663541c16ead/jaxws-ri/rt/src/main/java/com/sun/xml/ws/encoding/XmlDataContentHandler.java

It should be possible to either extend the class and override the isXml(..) method and thereby fixing the problem
column8:
or simply copy the hole class and work on a local modified version of the class.

Jacob Mogensen
mySupply ApS
Denmark"

column1: {"issue":"Oracle statistics query fails with ORA-00979: not a GROUP BY expression"

The use of numbered columns is not supported in ORDER BY clauses. The same query with *named* columns DOES work - for instance:

SELECT
  ap

FROM

WHERE
  direction = 'OUT'
  and tstamp between sysdate-10 and sysdate
GROUP BY ap
column24:

FROM
  raw_stats
WHERE
  direction = 'IN'
  and tstamp between sysdate-10 and sysdate

column1: {"issue":"Remove BIS document sniffing and SBD encapsulation"
column2:
body:"Current implementation inspects supplied document to determine the XML document type (scheme). If no SBD/SBDH (Standard Business Document with Standard Business Document Header and accompanying payload) detected:
 1. Parse the XML document to determine the PEPPOL Document type identifier and process identifier
 1. Create SBD with appropriate SBDH
 1. Wrap supplied document in SBD
 1. Commence transfer of document.

In the future all documents will be rejected unless they have been wrapped in an envelope according to the PEPPOL standards. This will be done in two phases:

 1. Refactor the current sniffing and wrapping into a separate component and deactivate this feature by default in ```oxalis-global.properties```. This will alow the operator to explicitly activate the feature if needed.
 1. Remove the feature from the code. 

The end result: all messages must be wrapped according to PEPPOL standard *before* being submitted into Oxalis for transportation.

The sniff&wrap code will continue to be available for those wishing to implement their own value added services."

column1: {"issue":"equals and hashCode method of URL perform domain name resolution"
column2:
body:"Referring to eu.peppol.outbound.soap.SoapDispatcher: Maps and sets of URLs can be performance hogs.

This can result in a big performance hit and is marked by Sonar (FindBugs) as a blocking issue. 
I haven’t verified this is an issue in this particular case
column3:
but it is worth measuring. 
The common suggestion is: consider using java.net.URI instead.

How to reproduce (using SonarQube. IT is also reproduceable with plain FindBugs):
```
>git clone <repo>
>mvn install -Dmaven.test.skip=true
>mvn sonar:sonar -Dmaven.test.skip=true
```
See sonar output


This occurs in all JDKs (also 8):
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/net/URL.html#equals(java.lang.Object)

See also:
http://michaelscharf.blogspot.fi/2006/11/javaneturlequals-and-hashcode-make.html

Findbugs issue “DMI_COLLECTION_OF_URLS”: http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/bugDescriptions.html"

column1: {"issue":"EHF Question concerning negative amounts using prepaid amount element"
column2: body:"Hi Difi
column3:
We've received a file which had a LegalMonetaryTotal and TaxTotal structure like below exemplified. The issue we had was that the PrepaidAmount contained a negative amount. As far as we can find in the specification only RoundingAmount could contain a negative amount (not taking into account the quantity elements). 
However I could not find any information regarding PrepaidAmount being negative.

In our case
column4: the negative PrepaidAmount was actually a fee to be paid (a fee from the previous invoice which was not paid)
column5: the calculation in schematron will give correct result since PrepaidAmount is always deducted from the amount to be paid (PayableAmount). \r\nHowever
column6:
we would interpret PrepaidAmount to only be used when you have an actual PrepaidAmount to present i.e an amount that should be deducted from the payment and not added. An additional fee from a previous invoice might better be presented as an own article (InvoiceLine) Alternatively using the AllowanceCharge structure.

What is your input in this case? Will the EHF format allow the use of negative prepaid amounts?

Please see below example to further explain:

 ```<cac:TaxTotal>
    <cbc:TaxAmount currencyID="NOK">25.00</cbc:TaxAmount>
    <cac:TaxSubtotal>
      <cbc:TaxableAmount currencyID="NOK">100.00</cbc:TaxableAmount>
      <cbc:TaxAmount currencyID="NOK">25.00</cbc:TaxAmount>
      <cac:TaxCategory>
        <cbc:ID schemeID="UNCL5305">S</cbc:ID>
        <cbc:Percent>25</cbc:Percent>
        <cac:TaxScheme>
          <cbc:ID>VAT</cbc:ID>
        </cac:TaxScheme>
      </cac:TaxCategory>
    </cac:TaxSubtotal>
  </cac:TaxTotal>

  <cac:LegalMonetaryTotal>
    <cbc:LineExtensionAmount currencyID="NOK">100.00</cbc:LineExtensionAmount>
    <cbc:TaxExclusiveAmount currencyID="NOK">100.00</cbc:TaxExclusiveAmount>
    <cbc:TaxInclusiveAmount currencyID="NOK">125.00</cbc:TaxInclusiveAmount>
    <cbc:PrepaidAmount currencyID="NOK">-25.00</cbc:PrepaidAmount>
    <cbc:PayableAmount currencyID="NOK">150.00</cbc:PayableAmount>
  </cac:LegalMonetaryTotal> ```



We would appreciate your feedback. 

Thank you in advance.
"

column1: {"issue":"Element for buyer in addition to AccountingCustomerParty"
column2: body:"We have seen a need for information about the buyer in addition to the payer in the case where those two are not the same. EHF is starting to be used by utility companies (grid and power suppliers) for re-invoicing
column3: and there is a need for having information about the end user (buyer) in addition to the power supplier which is the accounting customer party. The UBL 2.1 spec
column4: which as I understand EHF is a subset of
column5: includes a buyer element (cac:BuyerCustomerParty). The request is to include this element in a future version of EHF. "

column1: {"issue":"Varsling til innbygger bør bruke oppdatert kontaktinformasjon fra kontaktregisteret "
column2:
body:"Det bør åpnes opp for at Avsender ikke sender inn kontaktinformasjon og at denne heller slåes opp fra kontakt og reservasjonsregisteret på varslingstidspunktet av postkasseleverandørene.

Dette krever følgende endringer:

Endring i Varslingfeilet i ```sdp-kvittering.xsd``` slik at epostadresse/mobiltelefonnummer oppgis til Avsender dersom varslingen til innbygger feiler
column3:
slik at Avsender vet hvilken kanal som er forsøkt brukt.

i sdp-melding.xsd endre:
```<xsd:element name="epostadresse" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:string"/>```
til: ```<xsd:element name="epostadresse" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:string"/>```
og så må følgende endres fra:
```<xsd:element name="mobiltelefonnummer" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:string"/>```
til: ```<xsd:element name="mobiltelefonnummer" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:string"/>```

i tillegg må følgende avklares/håndteres:

- Hvordan skal Avsender avgjøre kanal som det skal varsles på. 
  - Må de oppgi varslingstekst på begge kanaler?
  - Problemet er at Avsender da ikke kan vite med 100% sikkerhet om kanalen vil bli e-post eller sms. For innbygger kan endre/slette kontaktinformasjon fra KRR i perioden fradigital post ble sendt til innbygger skal varsles. 
  - Mulig at det bør innføres en prioritert liste over kanal som Avsender kan sette slik at postkasseleverandøren kan forsøke å velge korrekt kanal.


"

column1: {"issue":"Feil navnerom i Asic-e signature xml fila"
column2: body:"I Digital post til innbyggere benyttes følgende navnerom i XSD
column3:
eksempelfiler og signatures.xml file generert fra javabiblioteket:

´´´http://uri.etsi.org/2918/v1.2.1#´´´

I standarden som man lenker til på http://begrep.difi.no: http://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/102900_102999/102918/01.03.01_60/ts_102918v010301p.pdf
benyttes følgende navnerom: 

´´´http://uri.etsi.org/02918/v1.2.1#´´´


EU benytter i Digital Signature Service (DSS) i eSignature Building Block korrekt:
https://github.com/esig/dss/blob/0226e208251b333c3773d81f8d62a31034150cb8/dss-spi/src/main/java/eu/europa/esig/dss/ASiCNamespaces.java

Fedict (Belgia) benytter feil i sitt prosjekt eid-applet:
https://code.google.com/p/eid-applet/source/browse/trunk/eid-applet-service-signer/src/main/resources/ts_102918v010101.xsd

Feil navnerom har også forplantet seg til innleveringsløsningen:
https://github.com/difi/asic/blob/master/src/main/xsd/ts_102918v010201.xsd

kan ikke finne noen på hvor utgaven med galt navnerom kommer fra
column4:
men dette bør ihvertfall ryddes opp i.


"

burde vell være http://begrep.difi.no/SikkerDigitalPost/1.2.0.RC1/meldinger/AapningsKvittering ?

column1: {"issue":"Behov for å kunne sende fler enn 10 vedlegg til innbygger"
column2:
body:"Det er avsender som har forsendelser med fler enn 10 vedlegg til innbygger.
Det er i mange saker opp til 20 vedlegg og i enkelt saker snakk om over 100 vedlegg.

Det er ønskelig at digital postkasse kan ta i mot også slike forsendelser og at utskrift og forsendelsestjenesten muliggjør utskrift til de som ikke har digital postkasse.

Begrensningen i dagens XSD gjør at avsender ikke kan ta i bruk digital postkasse fult ut for innbyggere som ønsker digital post
column3: i tillegg så hindrer begrenses også mulig for å ta i bruk utskriftstjenesten fult ut."

column1: {"issue":"Beskrivelse av Ansvarlig enhet  er uklar under Aktører"
column2: body:"Forklaringen (http://begrep.difi.no/SikkerDigitalPost/forretningslag/Aktorer) er som følger:\r\n\r\n- Ansvarlig enhet brukes av Behandlingsansvarlig virksomheter med et stort virkeområder som ønsker å differensiere Avsendere til Innbygger avhengig av de interne enhetene som sender posten
column3:
i de tilfeller der det ikke er mulig eller lite hensiktsmessig at interne enheten selv er identifisert som behandlingsansvarlig (ved å ha et eget sertifikat).

Dette er vanskelig å forstå fordi det er mange skrivefeil og setningen er veldig lang.
"

column1: {"issue":"Canonicalization med http://www.w3.org/2006/12/xml-c14n11 er ikke støttet av java 1.6
column2: grensesnittet må oppdateres til å støtte fler forskjellige Canonicalization metoder."
column3:
body:"krav 6.2.2 	“Canonicalization of ds:SignedInfo element” beskrevet her: http://begrep.difi.no/SikkerDigitalPost/1.0.2/forretningslag/Sikkerhet/ er ikke støttet av Java 1.6.

Grensesnittet er nå definert med følgende krav:
```
Skal være http://www.w3.org/2006/12/xml-c14n11
```

Må oppdateres for å også støtte java 1.6 slik:


```
Bør være http://www.w3.org/2006/12/xml-c14n11
Kan være http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315
```


"

column2: body:"Hvordan refererer vi til en dokumentpakke? Tidligere hadde vi en identifikator i manifest.xml
column3: men den er tatt vekk. Det er ikke tenkt at SBD må lagres over tid
column4: så da forsvinner også identifikatoren der.\r\n\r\nHvis det er noe feil med signatur
column5: dokumenter eller lignende som oppdages etter lengre tid
column6: så er det viktig å kunne referere dokumentpakken opp mot logger."

column2: type xs:dateTime?"
column3: body:"Dette er tidspunktet post ble mottatt i postkassen
column4: og er sannsynligvis hos postkasseleverandør lagret med fullt timestamp for å kunne få til en forventet sortering. Dersom dette tidspunktet overføres kun som en type `xsd:date` (uten tidspunkt på dagen) vil flyttet post bli sortert tilfeldig innenfor samme dato. Foreslår å endre typen til `xsd:dateTime` og følgelig element-navnet til `mottakstidspunkt`."

column1: {"issue":"Er det behov for et digitalt fingeravtrykk i leveringskvitteringen?"
column2: body:"Slik løsningen er nå kan avsender være trygg på at DigitalPostMelding er tilgjengeliggjort for innbygger etter mottak av LeveringsKvittering på bakgrunn av tillit mellom aktørene. Signaturen i leveringskvitteringen dekker en identifikator
column3: noe som ikke vil være kryptografisk tilstrekkelig ovenfor en tredjepart ved en eventuell tvist.\r\n\r\nHvis leveringskvitteringen i tillegg inneholder et digitalt fingeravtrykk (hash) av den digitale posten
column4: så vil avsender også kunne dokumentere hva som ble sendt inn i løsningen for sikker digital post."

Logge to steder: teknisk og audit.

Audit hva som har skjedd

* Mottaker orgnummer
* Avsender orgnummer
* ConversationId
* DocumentId
* AltinnkvitteringId
(Dersom de er tilgjengelig)."

column2: body:"Hi
column4: and it helped me understand app renamed a lot more. Thanks a lot :-)\n\nI have a few suggestions for the project. Instead of sending a pull request
column5: I can imagine you'd like to rebase / force push a new history instead. Hence
column6: this ticket.\n\nThe second data migration for content-types can be merged into the first
column7:
by using:

```
    if not db.dry_run:
        ContentType.objects.filter(app_label='old_app').update(app_label='new_app')
````

(the only difference between a `SchemaMigration` and `DataMigration` is the fact that data migrations don't go through a dry-run)

The `was_applied` code can also be shortened:

```
def was_applied(migration_file_path
column8:
app_name):
    """true if migration with a given file name ``migration_file`` was applied to app with name ``app_name``"""
    migration_name = os.path.basename(migration_file_path).split('.')[0]
    return MigrationHistory.objects.exists(app_name=app_name
column9:
migration=migration_name)
```

I also found it useful to check for existing table names
column10: not sure if it applies here. (code is `if 'messages_message' in connection.introspection.table_names()`)\n\nHope this helps :-)"

column2: body:":: makes a code block
body:"I'd be very keen to try this within an organisation
column3: but one issue we come across is that no single team has the time to support a central service that might be used by other teams. I'd like to explore the idea that I could package things up nicely so that every part of the organisation can install this
column4: but there is some kind of federation or synchronisation going on such that either a) the questions are synchronised between all instances (import/export?) or b) at least the search can return questions on other people's instances.\r\n\r\nI can't see any explicit support this this use case so far (unless I missed it) and I'm happy to look at how that might work and even contributing it if there's interest
column5: but first I'd like to open up a bit of a discussion as to what's possible in askbot in its current state
column6: what approaches are the most promising and -- possibly most importantly -- what problems/constraints will prevent/hinder a distributed install like this so we know what paths will *not* work at least.\r\n\r\nSo

column2:
body:"According to the [WSGI-documentation](https://github.com/GrahamDumpleton/mod_wsgi-docs/blob/master/configuration-directives/WSGIRestrictStdout.rst):

> A well behaved Python WSGI application should never attempt to write any data directly to sys.stdout or use the print statement without directing it to an alternate file object. This is because ways of hosting WSGI applications such as CGI use standard output as the mechanism for sending the content of a response back to the web server. If a WSGI application were to directly write to sys.stdout it could interfere with the operation of the WSGI adapter and result in corruption of the output stream.

Unfortunately Askbot seems to do exactly that..

> mod_wsgi (pid=24504): Exception occurred processing WSGI script '/var/www/html/askbot-devel/django.wsgi'
> IOError: sys.stdout access restricted by mod_wsgi

Maybe do something like this:
```
import logging
import os
import sys
import time
import traceback
import signal

LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

current_directory = os.path.dirname(__file__)
parent_directory = os.path.dirname(current_directory)
module_name = os.path.basename(current_directory)

sys.path.append(parent_directory)
sys.path.append(current_directory)
os.environ['DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'] = '%s.settings' % module_name

from django.core.wsgi import get_wsgi_application
try:
    application = get_wsgi_application()
except Exception as e:
    # Error loading applications
    if 'mod_wsgi' in sys.modules:
    	LOG.error("Unexpected Exception Occurred")
        LOG.exception(e)
        os.kill(os.getpid()

body:"Please use UTF8 for passwords and not ASCII only.. That increases the keyrange a lot which makes it more secure\r\n\r\n> Auth exception: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\\\\xa7' in position 12: ordinal not in range(128)"

column1: {"issue":"Markdown preview inconsistent with render when using _Italics_ "
column2:
body:"This issue appears frequently on our local AskBot site.
Many posts are written by C programmers who write C macro names as part of their questions/answers. Macros are frequently built from words separated by underscore.

When writing the post
column3: on the MarkDown preview **underscores remain and does not convert to italics**. However
column4:
after posting we discover that underscore were removed from macro names and parts of the names were converted to italics.

### The main issue here is the inconsistency between the preview of the post and the final result.  


Examples:

---

When posting:

    TEST1_TEST2_TEST3  

**Preview** shows:

> TEST1_TEST2_TEST3  

But after posting
column5:
the post looks like this:

> TEST1*TEST2*TEST3 

(TEST2 is displayed in italics)

----

When posting
```
TEST1_TEST2  
TEST1_TEST2  
TEST1_TEST2
```

**preview shows it correctly** (without any italics). But after posting I get:
![askbot_test1_test2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11742638/14638795/bcee814e-0641-11e6-8b80-a60aa2e068d9.png)
"

column2: body:"While [not supported on StackOveflow](http://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/73566/is-there-any-markdown-to-create-tables)
column3:
MarkDown has extensions to support tables. For example in [GitHub](https://help.github.com/articles/organizing-information-with-tables/) and [Wikimedia](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Tables).  

It could be very useful if AskBot supported some way of adding tables into posts.  

[Markdown-here](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/) does it [nicely](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#tables)."

column1: {"issue":"[API] Return a list of answers for every question in 'api/v1/questions/'"
column2:
body:"As found in several questions like:

[How do I get answers by using the Rest API?](http://askbot.org/en/question/13504/how-do-i-get-answers-by-using-the-rest-api/)
[Web API for answers export?](http://askbot.org/en/question/13176/web-api-for-answers-export/)
[Adding Answer Functionality to the API](http://askbot.org/en/question/12881/adding-answer-functionality-to-the-api/)

There's no way to retrieve the answers through the API. I've tried to find the functionality which is not avilable
column3:
but I've found a PR with a similar approach:

https://github.com/ASKBOT/askbot-devel/pull/334

As modern API's models returns all the information in the same entity (question)
column4: why not to retrieve all the answers in a list called 'answers' instead just 'answer_ids'? It should be an easy change. Would you accept a PR for that?\r\n\r\nBest!"

column2: body:"In view of recent developments such as support for Django 1.7 mentioned at https://github.com/ASKBOT/askbot-devel/issues/485

column1: {"issue":"Flagged posts show up in rss feed"
column2: body:"I've seen a lot of spam posts on our aksbot site these last few days. The good thing is that they are all flagged
column3:
and hidden from normal users.

The strange thing is that when the rss feed is requested for that site all these spam posts are included.

Is there a setting to filter this?"

column1: {"issue":"Writing \"chmod 755\" in any answer throws an error"
column2: body:"At ask.sagemath.org
column3: a user was having strange trouble answering a followup question.  After some digging
column4:
it turns out he wanted to include the following in his post (describing what he tried):

    chmod 755 /Applications/Sage-6.8.app/Contents/Resources/English.lproj/*nib

This causes an error.  I've tried this in a few other places: the string "chmod 755" in an answer causes an error."

column2: body:"Using @ to mention someone does not render a link in the preview when asking or answering questions
column3:
but does once posted. This makes it hard to tell if you've spelled the username correctly.

From: https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/answers.ros.org/issues/124

Running: Askbot version 0.7.53 "

body:"Here's a quick list of the changes I think are warranted:

* The UX around creating events as a child of an event to make them display. I feel this should be simplified to have the parents show directly.

* Name in admin; "Active Sales" is overly verbose - "Sales" would do.

* An additional mode of selling: currently sales can be added to Taxons or Products.
I'd like to have multiple products in a sale rather than having to create a taxon dedicated to this.

* More sophisticated pricing. (?)

* Spree 3.0.0-beta compatibility

* some kind of discrete slug per sale for linking to it
column3: that then behaves differently when the sale is closed.\r\ne.g. send an email and get to the sale when it's active. Days after it's active see a \"this is now closed but here's the higher price
column4: or it's out of stock you might like this\"\r\n\r\n* Spree 2.3 introduces the `Spree::Store` model. Sales should be able to happen per store."

column1: {"issue":"\"Ambigious select statement\" error resulting from join"
column2: body:"In the admin panel
column3: when opening the page at reports->products->\"low stock\"
column4:
we get an error page. The report says (among other things):
>SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1052 Column 'qty' in where clause is ambiguous

A quick fix for this is to go to the class Etailer_Backorders_Model_Observer_Adminhtml and comment out the lines in the function joinFieldsToCollection. I've seen other solutions to this problem where they define a 'filter_index' when joining
column5: but I'm not sure how to implement that here."

column2: body:"Hi Robert
column3:
In app/code/community/Etailer/Backorders/etc/config.xml there is an observer for product collection load.

You add the field min_qty to the collection
column9:
'left');
    }

This is causing an error "You cannot define a correlation name 'mycustomattribute' more than once"; see also http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10524017/magento-layered-navigation-you-cannot-define-a-correlation-name-mycustomattrib

Happy to sponsor module development; this functionality is crucial for one of our business cases. Are you considering to develop this module for M2? 

Regards
Ronald

column1: {"issue":"Fatal Error using \"backorderable\" column filter in catalog in admin panel"
column2: body:"In the admin panel section Catlog->\"Manage Products\"
column3:
I set the "To:" values of "Qty" and "Backorderable" columns to zero and hit search I get a fatal error: 
> Fatal error: Call to a member function getBackend() on a non-object in /var/www/public_html/app/code/core/Mage/Eav/Model/Entity/Abstract.php on line 816

[This site](http://magento-quickies.alanstorm.com/post/91985359245/call-to-a-member-function-getbackend-on-a) seems to be talking about the same error. In our case
column4: \"min_qty\" seems to not be an attribute. Not sure why yet."
